review: This last visit we only had to wait 15mins before we were seated, which is actually pretty good.  Each time we've been here I can honestly say we've never had a bad experience with either a burger or a server. Honestly though the only thing that sucks is the bacon they use on the burgers. They look like those little strips you microwave, not cool especially for those bacon lovers.  We've even brought the girls here for a treat to see how they liked it, since they've never been. Well all three of them loved.  Make sure to join the rewards program, they send you several good deals through the year. A free gourmet burger for your birthday too.

Came here for lunch recently and it was a total lousy experience. The server lacked basic customer service skills. I mean if you can't even greet and pretend to like your job you are probably going to epically fail at it hands down. My order was wrong and I never got an apology. I had to ask multiple times for condiments. The food didn't taste fresh and the temp was cold. Meanwhile adjacent to us there was a PERFECT server!  Attentive, refilling drinks, checking in etc.  You name it. Only regret was it wasn't our server. Minus 1,2,3,4 and all five if I could for the lousy service and Red Robin not caring about my experience.  In and out would have been cheaper and so satisfying!  What a big mistake coming here. Never again.

I went to this Red Robin's today for an early dinner. I logged intoy rewards program and saw I had a 50 % off coupon that said we get half of any fire gourmet with purchase of any additional burger, entree, sandwich, or entree salad. I attached a photo as well. I showed this information to our server. Our server, John, said that this coupon would apply and that the chicken sandwich we ordered would be half off. Shortly after the manager came to our table and explained how it does not apply because I needed to get a "big" burger. Confused by her statement, I went to show her what my coupon said. She said , "I know what it says I don't need to see it". She didn't even apologize for the inconvenience that someone on her team conveyed the wrong information. Honestly, her rudeness ensued.  When our server came back he asked if everything was better now. We were blunt with him and explained that the coupon says nothing about a big burger/sandwich anywhere. He read the coupon and agreed that our confusion was valid.  The manager came back to our table and immediately took out a printed email that she got from corporate. And there it was.. "big or fine burger". She then added that I would have needed to order two gourmet sandwiches for this to be valid. I said okay I understand and she walked away. Didn't even apologize for the confusion. It was clear that she was very focused on proving me wrong rather than explaining the mix-up that was made.  I am writing this review to show that the coupon is infact different than the corporate email this manager received. I am also writing this review to express my frustration with how rude this manager was. Her server was more apologetic for her behavior.  Lastly, I don't want a discount. I don't want "a reason to come back". I don't think I'll be returning to this Red Robin's. Next time, consider the fact that customer service can outweigh a "cheaper meal".

Gah, no wonder these chain restaurants are going under. I remember really loving the Red Robin in Moreno Valley when I was 18 my sister and I would go every Saturday, but now 10 years later idk if it's just this location but I'd rather not chance it and spend my money here. Even with the 2 for one tavern deal, our bill was $35 (onion rings, two lemonades, chicken caprice and red tavern burger with the 2 for one deal). I didn't try any of the burgers, but the chicken caprice sandwich fell apart on a ciabatta bun that absorbed any little drop of moisture immediately apparently. Had okay flavor but was not appetizing. I had gotten this after sending the cod and shrimp duo back, which was watered down cod and since both of us have worked in fast food we both immediately were able to tell that the deep fryer oil is old because the batter on everything tasted bad. The fries tasted baked and then deep fried, just off for some reason. Would much rather spend my money at a good mom and pop for cheaper or similar pricing. The team member helping us was sweet and really personable and patient, the 2 stars are for him and nothing else about this place.

We came here to use a Red Robin loyalty rewards 50% off coupon that reads, in full, as follows: "50% off any Fire-Grilled Gourmet burger with purchase of any additional burger, entree salad, sandwhich, or entree. Expires 12/29/2017. Offer valid once per day. Discount applied to lowest priced Fire-Grilled Gourmet burger." No extra small text, no other caveats. This was the entirety of the coupon.  So with this deal in hand, we ordered a chicken sandwhich and a tavern burger. When we got our bill, Red Robin refused to honor the coupon, with the manager explaining that the coupon only applied to "Big" Tavern burgers, not "Small" ones like the one we had ordered. And therefore our order didn't qualify. Notice that the coupon does not state this extra requirement anywhere. And in fact, once we showed the manager the coupon itself, the manager PULLED OUT AN INTERNAL RED ROBIN EMAIL FROM CORPORATE explaining what the coupons "real" definition was. So not only are Red Robin coupons not valid as-written but apparently we're also supposed to know what Red Robin's internal policies are before we come in and try to use said coupons. Avoid this place, and perhaps this entire chain. Red Robin deals are apparently not worth the paper (or emails) they're written on. Literally.

This place has really gone downhill. Table was filthy when we were seated. Asked for bottomless fries and never got them. Food served on chipped plate. Still sitting here waiting for bottomless fries after our food has already been served. Haven't been checked on since food was served. The fruit salad tastes like nasty tap water. The burger has thin microwaved bacon on it. Totally disgusting. Can't believe what they charge for this crap. Oh and the restrooms are also filthy. They don't even replace the paper towels in the paper towel machine, they just have rolls sitting on sink.

Great service. Sat in the bar and Fox was our bartender/waiter. Can't recall the names of the burgers we ordered but mine had bleu cheese and my husbands had guacamole. I actually preferred his, but both were good. Bottomless fries and root beer floats? Uhhh hell yes! Good food, good service and great value.

4 stars for food, 2 stars for service. We frequent this place often for the food. The family is always satisfied with our burgers and food. Gluten free buns are good. Black and bleu burger is really good. Chicken waffle sandwich sucks, tastes like waffle and chicken dipped and sprinkled in sugar. Service is hit or miss, completely depends on who your server is. Some days are good, some days poor - more so when their busy, understandably so.

First off let me say, love that every time I walk in, the hostess is there to greet. I think that impression alone to let me know I'm notice and that I'm informed goes a long way. As for the food itself, I have yet to find something I dislike. I'm a burger lover, and so far each burger I've had hasn't disappointed me. I'm not saying they are the best, but the food is good, the service is good, and that alone brings me to give them 5 stars.

I just had a bad experience . The waitress took forever to get to our table. We kindly asked for a fork and had to remind her when she brought us the check. I know not all red robins are like this but just had to help this .

Went here with my family for a lunch. Lucky us there was no waiting, so we got a table within few minutes. Meagan was our server, she was great, very friendly and attentive, always had a smile in her face. She quickly took our orders when she knew we were hungry. Lol.  Food was served fast and prepared exactly as requested. Meagan frequently checked our table for water, ice tea refilled, so as fries. We appreciated that Meagan was very patient with my 8 months old grand daughter.  Here is the verdict for food: Banzai and Peppercorn burgers were all delicious, very juicy. Fish & chips was crispy and so was clucks. Love their sweet potato fries. So delicious. Kudos to Red Robin for giving 20% military discount for the whole month of July. Cheers!!! Lol.

On Feb. 26 2017 I came in to this earing establishment with 9 other guests and was greetly in a friendly manner. We were seated within 15 mins and waitresses came and introduced her self. Everything was going well we all order and got our food. I got a chicken cesar salad the food was nothing special very basic nothing that wow me.  The reason why I am rating it a 3 was because I had to take my daughter to the bathroom and noticed it need several things so I asked one of the short hair lady that was walking around asking guest how their meal was going. I figured she woulf be the ideal personal to let know that the bathroom needed a little tlc.  45 mind went by and I had to go to the bathroom again with my son this time. I was very upset that the bathroom situation was not address but most importantly that 2 out of the 3 bathrooms had no toilet paper and one of them did not have seat covers. It was very inconvenient for my son and I to scramble toilet paper when he need to use the facilities.

Slightly disappointed with the $6.99 tavern burger menu. There were only 3 burgers to choose from at $6.99. I ordered the sriracha burger and it was way too salty due to the salty onion straws. I did, however, enjoy the bottomless fries!
Food and drinks were really good! Service was also great! Will come again. The wait wasn't all too bad for the weekend.

Joaly was our waitress and the service was horrible. She was very rude. Continued to Rush us. She did not smile until it came to us paying our bill. Where of course when it comes to that she is going to for a nice tip. We waited over 15-20 minutes after we finished our food to pay our bill because the self pay thing did not have our bill on it. Our bill was put onto someone else's table. Also every time we were out of our drink we had to find her to ask for a refill. I will not return to this location due to the horrible service we had.

First time here at this Red Robin. We usually go to the one in Glendora but moved to the IE-- so here we are. Like the other RR - it's right off the freeway. It shares a parking lot with several other restaurants so I can see how parking can sometimes be tough. We came during a weeknight and it was pretty busy. We only had to wait maybe 5 minutes though Our server was super nice despite the hustle and bustle of the evening. We ordered drinks and our favorite ...the Bleu Burger with the endless Garlic fries. We asked the fries to be brought out early since I was starving. Everything is exactly what I expected from RR. Burger was super delicious- cooked exactly as requested  and fries crisp and seasoned perfectly. No issues with this restaurant, food or service. 5 stars well deserved!

First, let call out the single good thing about this place:  The host.   He greeted us immediately, he took our information, and he got me an ice water right away.   If there was a way to separately rate him, he'd get five stars. Unfortunately, the rest of the visit didn't even warrant a single star, but Yelp won't let me go lower than one.   Our waitress took our order, and delivered the waters.   Then a half an hour went by.  We were beginning to debate simply leaving, because the waitress was obviously avoiding our table, and no manager seemed to be on duty.   The waitress suddenly appeared and gave us a half-hearted apology for the wait, claiming "a to go order just came in for 44 burgers, so we're way behind."  This means that either a) they knew they had a large to go order when she took our order, and it took them half an hour to inform us of the wait, or b) they took the to go order AFTER ours, and put our order behind it.   Either way, unacceptable.   She then asked us if we just wanted our fries while we waited.  So basically we were offered part of our order as a replacement?  It didn't even make sense.   But whatever, we assumed this meant our order would be out shortly. It took another 15-20 minutes for the order to finally come out, and it had quite obviously been sitting out for a good portion of that.  The burgers were warm, but not hot.  The fries, normally  a Red Robin favorite, tasted like frozen fries popped in the oven for not quite enough time.  The waitress once again began avoiding our table, taking the long way around to visit the table next to us and then walking away in the opposite direction while pointedly ignoring us.    Oh, and during this 45-50 minute wait, our drinks were refilled exactly once (before any food was ever brought out).   Once we got our food, we never got another visit from our waitress.  We paid our bill on the electronic kiosk and left. Can't say as we have any desire to ever return, either.

Vegetarian review:  They use to be good but their quality went way down.  We both got the veggie burger and it was undercooked and tasted weird, I took out the patty after a few bites. Their fries were also undercooked so we requested another batch and it was the same.  Their Oreo milkshake was pretty good but it was too small, should've ordered the large.  I got a side of mac n cheese and it was pretty good, probably the only decent thing I ordered that day. Overall we were very disappointed in the main entrees this time around, we both would've rather went to Farmer Boys for our veggie burgers and fries. Cheaper and tastes much better than Red Robin. We were not happy or satisfied after visiting this place.
This place is awesome! John was so absolutely amazing even though he was so busy. He literally ran around the whole time we were there but was always taking care of us. The food was great, too!

So disappointed in this Red Robin...unfortunately it's the only one nearby. My husband and kids just went to dinner there and brought me the Ensenada platter. Chicken was dry and hard and they put the hot chicken breasts on top of the salad!?!?! So much for looking forward to my meal

I used to love going to Red Robin in Galleria Tyler Mall in Riverside. But having tried their branch here in Foothill Blvd. in Rancho Cucamonga it was a total disappointment. Fries are hard to chew and too starchy in this branch. Their gourmet burgers are over done when you ask for "medium well". The service sucks as the servers take forever to attend to the table--especially last week when we dined, it was a fund raising night with the police officers and the Red Robin crew took forever to even respond to the blinking green "call for service" light in our table. The second round of fries were harder and starchy as well. For the price id rather go to Habit.

First time here! I had a free burger for my birthday and it's totally worth it. I had the porterhouse burger with garlic fries and it was completely free. I'm surprised they didn't charge me for the garlic fries substitution.  The burger was pretty good. I asked for it to be cooked medium well but it was kinda dry, I'll probably go for medium next time. The garlic fries were too overwhelming. After a few pieces, I was done. Too much grease. Also, my burger was topped with 1 onion ring and it was soooooo good. I have to get that next time.  During the month of May, they have a buy one get one half off, so I suggest going now. And definitely join their rewards program. They give a lot of deals like every 10th burger is free, I think.  Also, practically everything here is BOTTOMLESS even the root beer floats. I cannot handle all of that.  Food took forever to come out. Our server was okay, nothing too spectacular, but not horrible either.

I so want to love this place but I just cannot get past the poor service.  After years of leaving this place in my review mirror; I finally went back in hopes they learned from past mistakes and declining visits from the local population.  Ugh!  If I did not like the tortilla soup so much; I would have to leave again for a few years The timing of the food delivery - Only one person at a time gets their food and when you try to be polite and wait to eat until everyone has his or her food; your food will be stone cold before the others get their entrees.  They need to sync the delivery so everyone at the same table gets their order and can eat together. Don't go thirsty!  Drinks and refills are rare commodities.  Music is too loud.

The place is clean and the food is decent... customer service was good... the only thing I did not like was when I paid with cash the server asked if I wanted my change... I don't like that at all... the change coming back was about half of what the actual bill was... I'm not a cheap person and have no problem leaving a tip... but c'mon almost half the bill? Maybe if the server was doing magic tricks or had band backing them up... to be real the order was also messed up for two of the people in our party... as a customer it's up to me if I'm going to give a server a tip and of how much it will be... it's pretty much based off of getting things done right... I just think that's a horrible way for a server to go about it...

The Bruschetta Chicken burger was the best tasting burger I've EVER in my life had. The chicken so moist it almost melted in my mouth.....I was in taste bud Heaven. And the garlic fries were so fresh and crispy.....I really enjoyed my meal

Disappointed. The burger was greasy and no BBQ sauce on a BBQ burger. Fries okay but just not tasting very fresh. Service was good. Nice quiet environment. Loved our server. Not sure if I would return to this location.

If you want to consume all of your daily calories and exceed your sodium content, you found your place. I had to allow myself to "splurge" , I got the A1 Peppercorn burger with the sauce on the side to try first. I'm glad I did, because I did not care for the sauce. But, I did love the smoky tasty burger. I haven't had a Dr. Pepper in a very long time. This place had the best syrup to carbonated water ratio. It was perfect. Our server Holly was devine. As was our manager. Great customer service. Clean restaurant. Even if I did see an employee kick a French fry on the floor somewhere beyond sight. He was asked to pick it up. I prefer a good half pound burger, ours were cooked pink perfect. I suppose this place could be called pricey, but the quality of the employees and food is worth it. No internet, for customers.

This was our first visit to this location. It shares a parking lot with Pieology just south of Victoria Gardens. The wait quoted was accurate. The seats inside the waiting area was clean but not very comfortable as the cushions need to be replaced.  There were a few large parties in the dining area. The server designated to our table was busy so another one initially introduced himself as someone helping her out. We never saw her. It worked out because he was great. He was able to steer us to the items suitable to our dietary needs. The food was delivered promptly and as ordered. He checked on us; re-filling our beverages and bottomless items. They don't hold back on the bottomless fries... (we had it refilled 2x). We ordered the Keep it Simple Burger with Bottomless Freckled Fruit Salad. The burger was good but the fruit salad did NOT look appealing. It looked like it was out on the counter for awhile. However, it did taste fresh. From the Kid's menu we ordered Red's Beef Burger with cheese, bottomless fries and apple juice. It was a no nonsense burger which satisfied a very finicky kid. The server assisted in processing our coupon so the correct amount was reflected in the pay at the table tablet. NOTE: if paying by cash, must pay through your server. Although the payment went through, the tablet ran out of paper. After flagging our server, he was able to provide us the receipt.

I was craving a turkey burger from Red Robin, so the hubby & I went to the one on Foothill & Day Creek. At 8:45pm, we figured the dinner crowd would have died down. We were mistaken! The hostess told us there was a 30 minute wait, but there was a tall table available in the bar area so we took it. We were promptly given menus...and that was all that we got on this visit! No greeting from a server...no water...nothing. After about 10 minutes of nothingness, I made a comment about the lack of service and the couple at the next table said they were experiencing the same (they were waiting for their check). We decided to leave and notified the hostess that our table was available because we weren't even acknowledged. She graciously apologized even though it wasn't her fault.  If I ever crave a RR turkey burger again, I may just order take out.

I love this Red Robin. We've been coming here with our 2 kids for the past 5 years or so. We usually have really nice waiters/waitresses that stay on top of making sure our drinks are not empty and that our table always has fries on it.  The food always taste delicious. I usually go with the royal Robin burger. My wife gets the simply grilled chicken sandwich. My kids get the chicken strips or the pizza. Our drinks of preference are the different lemonades they offer.   My only complaint about this restaurant is that it can have a super long wait time on weekends and weekday evenings. But that is to be expected at most restaurants if they actually are good ones.

I was there today getting a burger and a drink and  Travis at the bar dropped a glass right front of me. Glass going down my dress and in my purse all over the place it seems every time I go alone something happens.  The food is good but service and otherwise not

Please don't go here we had a terrible experience.  two out of five of our orders were wrong and a 3rd was totally burnt.  THen when we asked for a burger that wasnt burnt it came back burnt again 15 min later.  It took forever to get our food and could tell it was sitting there for 30 minutes before it came to us, basically cold.  We used to like Red Robin but I wont got to any Red Robin for a long time now.

The food is good but service wasn't so good. We were there around 9pm, they close at 10pm so we figured we still have some time to enjoy dinner, and there were not many ppl dining on a Tuesday, so server was not busy at all. We ordered appetizer but the plates our server gave us was dirty, we simply didn't use them. Finally the burger was up, and we wanted second round of fries, the server did not come check on us after he served the burger, we pressed the server call button for a while, and it was 9:50pm when he finally came to our table then we asked for fries, all he said was kitchen was already closed, you would think kitchen would still be open during business hour, but apparently not.  He did not come back to give us check and it was past 10pm already, we figured out how to pay thru the machine on the table but the receipt did not print bc it was jammed. I would recommend not coming here before closing, it seems like the night shift server just wanted to go home...I love the food here but the night shift service was just disappointing....

Ordered online for pick up at RR. The system for ordering online is excellent. It is user friendly, and simple. Building your order is a snap. RR quality is always good, and the service is always friendly. The only issue, a 13.00 hamburger? That's a little steep.

Have been going to this particular Red Robin for years since moving to this area. Today's experience, made it the final straw. Not only did it take approximately 25 min to get our food after ordering, our appetizers came out with the meal, and not beforehand as expected. Also ordered was a bowl of chicken tortilla soup that never came out, so I canceled that and had it removed from the bill. Refills took forever, only after asking the manager for a refill. We went today for lunch, and the entire restaurant was maybe 30% to capacity so no reason why table service was so terrible (maybe short staffed like usual chain restaurants)  I understand the manager is trying to run a restaurant with the budget he was given by corporate, but he needs to fight more for his restaurant and be better staffed with employees to meet the needs of their customer base.  Will be going to another burger restaurant in the future from now on

Ive never had an issue with this establishment. Food, service, cleanliness has always been great! Kind of surprised to read the reviews that are left. Maybe I have gotten lucky or they come on a bad day. However, our servers have always been quick. The food is good for a late night dinner.

First time @ this location.   Service not that great, greeter  was nice but possibly was overwhelmed.  The bartender was nice.  I had the burger with fries waited a while for the food, the food wasn't hot,  More like room temperature!  It  seemed like it was  under the food lamp for a while  What a disappointment!  I will not be coming to this location anymore!

we ate there last night. Let me say the host Joseph and our waiter Adrian were very, very friendly and helpful.I ordered a Whisky burger with sweet potato fries, both was delivered to my table ICE COLD, I sent it back, i was delivered a different type of burger with regular fries. The burger was warm NOT HOT , but the regular fries were hot. Later Adrian brought me sweet potato fries. My friend ordered a regular burger with regular fries, he said the burger was warm, but the fries were hot.I don,t know if we will be back. Maybe, maybe not.

I called in on Sunday to place a To Go order and was told food would be ready in 17min. I arrived in 20min and told the Host I was here to pick up an order and she told me to head to the bar and ask them. Stood around the bar for a few minutes until I grabbed someone's attention and told them I was there to pick up some food and was told to sit down and wait, food will come out once it was ready.  So there I am sitting down lol. another 20min pass by and I tell this lady walking by if she can check on my order, I see where she goes and she grabs my food, the same bag I had seen a few min after I arrived and nobody cared to check it, or bring it to me. Terrible Service! Food was cold and gross.

My family and I came in tonight for dinner.  They were very busy but luckily we got Meagan for our server.  She is outstanding!  She is really on top of everything. Drinks flowed seamlessly from the bar.  Our food came out quickly and exactly the way we ordered it.  She is very pleasant and personable.  Thanks Meagan we really enjoyed your service!
Great tavern burgers & great steak fries. Server was awesome her name is Shelby. Food was hot and had great flavor.

Went last night for my sister in laws birthday and this place has really gone downhill. The service was bad, the floors were filthy and it was just ghetto in general. Our waitress brought a beer to my brother in law but when my brother in law took a sip he informed the waitress that he didn't order a corona. The waitress then took the beer he had already taken a sip out of and gave it to another customer. My husband ordered a BBQ bacon cheeseburger with a egg on it and it looked like a crappier version of a Carl's Jr. burger. I ordered half of a blta and French onion soup...and they brought me a whole blta (not complaining, it was delicious) and a bowl of tortilla soup. All in all I was really disappointed with the service, food and cleanliness of this Red Robin. I will not be going back.

Was impressed with our waitress Kristyn because she noticed one of the glasses she was going to pour water into had crud on it and took it back and got another one. Also, she was attentive and pleasant and when notified us that our order was taking a while because the kitchen staff didn't receive the ticket and offered us a basket of fries for the extra wait. Whiskey river BBQ burger is always my go-to and they never disappoint. Would recommend eating here if  you're craving a great burger at a good price!

Ordered a gourmet burger. Only came with (and I counted) 7 fries. I know fries are endless so I'm not mad about that. I'm upset about the coupon I had saying 50% off a gourmet burger with an additional purchase.. that's super vague and not clear I assumed my soda which I purchased along with my burger was the "additional purchase" as for the coupon not being very clear. Nope I was told have to buy another burger to get it. So I ended up paying 20 bucks for my burger fries and a drink.. thanks for your badly written coupons
We love the food but the service is terrible it's 3pm on a Tuesday, there's 4 employees working at the bar. Did I say working I mean lounging around.

The worst it will be a long time or never before I come back. They said the wait was 35 min. We waited then I notice the outside was empty, so we asked they said it would be 5 min they just needed a server nearly 35 min later they sat us at a table.we got to the restaurant at 6 by 643 we finally had a waiter we had no drinks till 715 which my husband got himself from the bar are  onion came first at like 710 we had no napkins no silverware finally the waiter got are drinks which we told him to cancel I asked for napkins 20 minutes later still waiting my husband had to go get them horrible the waiter was all over the place we finally got refills and it's 736. Are bill is not right. Don't come here!!!!!

Oldie but a goodie. Their burgers, whiskey river wrap and crispy chicken salad are my faves. The service is pretty consistent and above average. They recently added chilli cheese fries to their menu and they were great as well. Dine or Dash? Keep those items on the menu and I will always be back to dine.

Driving by and noticed a sign 6.99 for burger and fries. On the picture burger seems a normal size... But when I got it, to my surprise!!! It's a mini burger! They ought to say " "it not a regular burger it's a mini burger"

I brought the buy one 2nd get half off coupon this burger shop.... I ordered lettuce wrap chicken burger accidently  So I asked some bun w my burger w all the lettuce  But they put such a cheap ugly bun without all the lettuce  I coudnt believe " Is this really expensive Red Robin burger"???  Maneger is such a nesty white man  I believe maneger told to get rid of all the fresh lettuce.  I,ll never go this store again.  Horrible experience!!

My husband and I love the Whiskey River BBQ Burger and Chicken sandwich. We go here way more often than we should but we love it. I finally decided to yelp about the girl who took our order to go on our most recent visit. Her name was Jewell. She was super friendly and greeted us with a smile then looked for us (we were sitting outside) to give us some bottomless fries.  THAT is customer service! We've never had anyone do this out of the many time we've been to RR (including other locations). Jewell you're awesome. Keep up the good work!

Today was a much better experience than in the past. The wait was a bit long 45 min but that's not their fault many people had the same idea tonight. However the service was great. The host was able to let us know when we were next the server came right away and things came out hot and correct. In addition the restrooms were clean... and if you been in here the past 3 months you know that's not be normal. Even though one of the toilets were out of order they were clean and 2/3 still working. I'm glad to see orders were coming out correct hot and prompt. This will make me wish to dine here again more than once ever 6-8 weeks. Great job people.

Over the years, Red Robin has been a decent choice for a bigger, tastier, non-fast-food burger. Add in the bottomless steak fries and you never go hungry here. I typically order the chili chili cheeseburger while my wife gets the turkey burger. We're usually satisfied and full, and always feel like we got our money's worth. For the most part, I like the food and service here; although it can be inconsistent in both areas, I've never had a bad experience overall. If anything, I've had a "meh" meal every now and then, which is why I don't come here too often. It's a step or two below the gourmet burgers at nearby Slater's 50/50, but at least the wait isn't as long.

Came here with my family for a late dinner. The wait was 40 minutes but they called us up sooner for a shorter wait time. I wanted something on the lighter side since I wasn't too hungry so I got the chicken ensanada platter. The waitress was nice and friendly but took a while to take our orders (I felt bad that a family member said a mean comment for taking so long to get our order, the looked understaff since I didn't see many waiters around). They have these screen tablet devices at each table where you can order drinks, appetizers, pay for your bill, and even play games while waiting (but at an extra cost). My cousin and I accidently paid for the tablet games, but ended up having a lot of fun with the trivia games while we waited for our food.  When our food came, we realized that we didn't have any utensils so had to ask for them and wait a bit longer to eat (at least for those that need forks and knives). The chicken was good, but the side salad that came with it was underwhelming (can't expect much since they're known mostly for their burgers). My cousin got sweet potato fries which are my favorite. We both played the trivia games while eating so it was a fun experience.

This is a pleb restaurant, so pointless to review, but I needed to offset their 4.5 star rating. I was served a glass of water that tasted like dish soap and when I asked for a new one the waitress said "Oh yeah, everybody says that." Wtf. Fries were tough and cold, I ordered a salad that was spilling off the side and they were out of avocado. I get these mall restaurants though, there is so much guaranteed traffic that staff don't have time to focus on anything other than turning tables. Not at all worth $50. I will never be back.

The food is good, which is the only reason I keep giving this place another chance.  Service has been very poor, last time there I had to flag a manager down just to get my check so I could leave.  Must be to tight on labor or just don't train their servers, because its happened to many times to be a fluke.  The fact that there is always a wait surprises me, but its due partly to how long it takes to turn a table.  Hope the next time I come back service is better.
Sat in the bar area. Drink and appetizer order was taken right away. Blue Ribbon burger was delicious. Was offered a refill on fries.

The food was ok but the server wasn't much of a server! At no point and time after giving us our food did he ask if we needed anything else. I just happen to catch him walking by saying "thank you and come again"! Wth? Bottemles with no bottemless....that goes for the fries and the drinks! All glasses are empty and with 5 people at the table, you brought over 2 things of fries, really? Then, I catch him to ask for more fries and in the midde of asking, he just walks away. Customer service is out the window! Along with that tip......

I was there for 30 mins with my girlfriend after being told only a 10 min wait and watched everyone else who came in after get seated first. And the girl and guy up front didn't even have the nerve to great us.

The food was good, but there were some issues.  When we started looking at our menus, I noticed that they were different.  Mine had meals in it my guests did not.  When I asked the waiter about it he didn't know why and didn't even bother to check.  So I ordered off the menu only to find out that the meal I wanted was no longer available.  "oh so that is the wrong menu" the waiter commented.  No DUH!  Prices are OK but some of the portions were small.  Beware of the at-table pay station. Good way to get hacked, I refused to use the machine.

It was our first visit and it was disappointing. As soon as we enter nobody was at reception to greet! After while she came and took us to the table. We order Boca burger n sides of garlic fries, bun was good but boca burger was too chewy and hard on sides. Garlic fries seems like they just put the raw oil on potatoes! We didn't know that sides were unlimited until we took online review after paying our bill through credit card on ziosk! Server never offered us sides second time! Floors and menus were so messy and dirty more than restrooms!  I won't go back again.

I came at 5:30 to get my table for 6 pm. To be told it would be an hour which then turned into be an hour and half.  Spoke with the manager and she gave me a snotty piss on my shoe excuse as to why my table would not be ready!! The only saving grace is the fabulous service we got on both our tables. The manger Mary is doing this establishment a diservice with her be excuses for poor customer service  that she herself can but fails to control. Thanks to our servers for the awesome save.

Sign up for Red Robin Royalty and you get a free burger on your birthday month! Woot! Genisys Burger - $11.49 - New burger promo for the Terminator movie. Had everything I wanted in my burger so I gave it a try. Medium patty with bacon, jalapeno, avocado on a cornmeal bun. One of the best burgers I tried here. The fries with honey mustard are my weakness! Crispy Chicken Salad - $10.59 - My favorite salad but today, not so much. Chicken was crispy and tender. Ranch is my go to dressing. For me the egg is an important part of this salad and I was so annoyed that they do not have any eggs. I wish they would have said something prior to me ordering this so I could have changed my order. Also supposed to come with pita bread, but they gave me burnt cheese bread.  I love the food at Red Robin but today the service was just lack luster. After eating it took over 20 minutes to find our server, get a takeout box, and pay.

This review isn't about the food, it's about an awesome server! John was very quick, efficient, and friendly. As busy as the restaurant was this evening, I expected a wait for refills and ranch. Instead, John was on it and happy to serve us. Half the time we didn't even have to ask for anything. Wish I could have him serve us at every restaurant we visit. Thanks for the awesome experience, John!

I'm giving 3 stars because I've been here before and I know they can do better. However, if last night had been my first experience here, I would be leaving 2 stars and probably wouldn't return.  It was busy and our server was obviously overwhelmed. We were a party of 3 w/ a high chair and we were grateful to have a table with the pace for our little one. We were there for a total of 45 minutes (though we would have been finished in 30); we knew what we wanted and our server only had to get our drinks before we were ready to order. We got fries for the table and asked for 3 sauces, it took 20 minutes and 3 requests before we received 2 of them. Our food came, my bbq burger had no bbq sauce on it and I asked again for the 3rd sauce and for bbq sauce to put on my burger. Originally, I was going to order dessert, but since food kept coming out for his large parties, our server didn't really come back after I finally got the 2 sauces I requested.  If we return to this location, we'll most likely leave our little one with our babysitter so we can sit at the bar knowing we're not competing with a large party for some sauce and refills from our server.

I went around 4:45 PM, although there are a lot of waiters and waitresses running around, but I really have to try to get my waitress's attention to get served. the food is ok but not worth writing home about.  The $2 "entertainment fee" was such a rip-off for using the little tablet to order food.  I was not "entertained" the least bit.

First time ever at Red Robin took our fam and we really enjoyed it before I came I went on yelp looked up reviews I was kind of iffy but glad I came still I know how picky ppl can be so I decided to just try it for myself and glad I did don't understand why ppl  said service was bad honestly they were great very friendly and Courteous food was good for the price will be definitely going back

We went early for dinner.  So it was quite and slow.  Just how we like it.  BUT we got a waiter that ignored us. Luckily other servers helped us.  We ordered sauce on the side for burger and it was half gone by the time we got it.  Food and drinks good.  Fries could be hotter but they were ok.

Average service.  We were greeted, seated and had a waitress attend to us almost instantly. Take for granted it wasn't that busy, so our service was good. The burger I ordered was delicious. The atmosphere of the restaurant was good. The only thing that was a negative to me, was that, as we finished appetizers and entrees, our plates just kept piling up on the table and the server never cleared them the entire time we were there.

After my special needs son was treated badly at another business when he went in to get a birthday treat, he was very upset and so was I.  So I called Red Robin and asked if there was something special to do for the birthday burger they give.  You have to register 24 hours in advance.  This was the only place that he wanted to go.  After I explained what happened that day, the manager Katie, said she would honor it.  Upon arrival, we were treated so wonderful,  Everyone went out of their way to make his day extra special!  The food was really good also.  We will be returning, and often.

Customer service here is at an all time low. The front hosts (guys) had big time attitudes and where not communicating correctly amongst each other. Our waitress looked and acted as if she hated her job. Very non-enjoyable experience. The only reason to come here was due to a gift certificate. Will not be coming back as there are so many extremely better places to eat at and have a great time. Very disappointed

If I could give this place NO STARS I WOULD!!! Waited more than 30 minutes to be seated!!!! There were MULTIPLE empty tables that needed cleaning!!! We showed up when there was hardly any people waiting!! Then as time passed the waiting lobby got packed!! I'm am outraged that I have waited SO long to be seated!!! NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE!!

Loved it was great food great service happy camper I recommend the guacamole burger every one was nice super nice loved it always feel welcomed when I come great place price not so great lol but it's worth it kurtis was our waiter dude was the best was on point with everything great place

I placed my lunch order on line for pick up today. When I got into the restaurant, Kyle was the one to help me with my order. There was not really any wait. I only had to wait while he brought my food out. But when he came and brought my drink, he also brought me a cup of fries for the wait. I thought that was really sweet and great customer service. He was very helpful and reviewed my order before sending me off with it! It was exactly how I wanted it. Extremely satisfied with my recent trip here.

If you make an order to go be sure you check it! I had more than two things wrong with our to-go order. I called back to let them know. I spoke with a very nice young lady named Eileen. She placed me on hold, then my call was picked up by a snotty, person named Brianna. She had the worst attitude ever!!!  I was calm and patient, as I explained how our order was incorrect. She said she checked it (which obviously was a lie) because had she really checked it, she would have noticed that my order was wrong! I told her that I took pictures of the incorrect order, and she said "Okay".. in the most snottiest voice ever! I had to drive back to get my order corrected.  Kirsten was managing at the time. She said she would speak with Brianna, and offered me a $20 gift card, and corrected my order. Thanks Kirsten, and Eileen, for making my Red Robin experience better. Brianna you need to quit! You have no business serving the public!!
This was the worst red robin. Awful service discussing food. Made us wait an hour and then served us COLD meal. NEVER COME HERE.

Food was delicious. And our server Lexi was one of the best we ever had here!  So attentive and kept everything refilled and our never ending fries kept coming without us even having to ask!  I had the crispy chicken sandwich with bacon and it was noisy and delicious

This place is ridiculous!Everytime we come here it gets worse and worse!We always have some type of issue with the food or the service.Reason y I still come here is bcus my son likes it but it's never a pleasant experience coming here.They definitely need someone to come in to fix things.
Bad service. Wrong orders. Long wait. I've been here many times and have had a great experience.  Unfortunately these guys let us down today.
The burgers were good, but the wait was horrible, even thought there wasn't that many people there. The service definitely wasn't  great either. Except for the bus boy. He was lit.

I've been to this location a few times and have received good and ok service. This time around I received excellent service from Terri. She was on it the whole time we were there and she was very helpful. Edit: Had to take a star off. I ordered a few meals to go today and I won't be doing that again from this location. I ordered sweet potato fries and they gave me regular. Asked for extra camp fire sauce and didn't give me any. Other locations when you ask for drinks to go they give you the big cups except this one and gave no utensils. Asked for some pink on the burgers and got the complete opposite.

I love their bottomless fries with their different sauces and also the root beer float. The fact that it has refills won me over lol  I usually get salads or split one of their burgers with my s/o. I'm not a big burger eater ... But it's always delicious.  It's always packed at this location so be prepared to wait!

Had dinner at Red Robin last night after spending the day at Disneyland.  Now let me start by saying that I normally frequent this location on a weekend usually around lunchtime, but have only had dinner here maybe 2 or 3 other times in the 7 years that I have lived near this one.  The food is always yummy and service of the wait staff is generally pretty good.  Our server last night (can't remember his name, but has blond hair, wears it in a ponytail and has a beard) always made sure our drinks were never empty.  Onion rings app was hot and crispy, my burger and my husbands burger were DELISH!  The reason I'm giving 4 stars is because someone needs to do something about the rude hostesses up front.  Now I get it, it was a busy Friday night, but come on, smile, say hello, and be nice...it's not that hard.  Yes, customers get upset if the wait is long, but a little bit of good customer service goes a long way.  Trust me, if you as the hostess are nice to your patrons, the wait won't seem nearly as long.  Get it together hostesses!

HORRIBLE service.  Our waitress Jazz was a hot mess.  Waited forever to pay for our bill. Had to track her down by the kitchen opening to only have her look me dead in the eye to quickly look away and continue to be on her phone.  That 5$ tip was far too expensive for her service.

The food is great!!!! Gluten free options are wonderful!   I really like this place, however, today after my husband and I finished our meal our server commented "you ate all of your burger and fries!? I couldn't do that!"  Then looked at me and said "You too!?  Wow!!!"  My husband and I both felt shamed for eating.   Horrible experience.    So, great food but rude waiters.

Big thank you to Benji, Kyle, and Taylor. Especially Taylor. After dropping off the car at nearby Sears we were stranded for a while and decided to grab a bite to eat. It wasn't long before my husband who has a heart condition felt very ill. We had already ordered and felt it would be better for him to sit in the fresh air. Benji was very accommodating and asked for our food to go while quickly cashing us out and bringing us our iced tea outside. While we waited for a while, we had nowhere to go anyway since we had to wait for the car. Taylor came out of the service exit and kindly brought us a water. Some time later he was walking to his car to leave and noticed we were still there. He went back and made sure we got our food. Personally it was a stressful situation but their accommodating service allowed us to make the best of it.....Oh yeah, and the food was great. I love that they have some healthier options like the salmon with broccoli.
love the food here and love therr service good vibes and have good food over all love to come here because its fast and have good drinks :)

Visited here on a Sunday afternoon hoping to grab some lunch. We checked in and were quoted a 20 minute wait time. They were right on time with their wait time, which my hunger appreciated.  To start, we ordered the Spinach Dip & a cup of clam chowder. I really didn't like the chips that came with the spinach dip. They had a heavy wheat taste to them, and not the light airy salted corn chip I'm used to. The clam chowder was just OK. I wasn't given soup crackers, which I love, and I didn't bother asking for any. For my entrée, I ordered the Simply Grilled Chicken Burger which came with all the toppings on the side. I forgot to ask them to add cheese, which made me sad because I LOVE cheese, but oh well, next time! My husband ordered the Whiskey BBQ Chicken Burger and I heard no complaints. I ordered the Grilled Chicken on a Stick and a side of fruit for my son. All in all, the food was OK.  The service was EXCELLENT! I really liked our waitress. She was super attentive and nice. She recommended we sign up for their Royalty Program and left an instruction sheet that walked us through the sign-up process which was as easy as sending at text, literally!  Overall, we were satisfied with our visit and will probably return.

Came for lunch around 1 pm today with a party of 4. We were seated within 5 minutes of putting our name on the list. Once arriving at the table our drink orders were taken promptly but took a little bit to receive. Our waiter seemed as though he was rushing us to order our meals and wanted to just get us in and out and move on to the next hoping to get as many tips as possible. He had a bad attitude and never brought silverware for us even when our meals arrived. I had to ask a waitress who was helping others to bring us napkins and utensils, as well as drink refills.  I also don't appreciate being hovered over at times because the waiter had nothing else to do and made it obvious he was just trying to look busy more than half the time we were there and never asked if we needed anything else....just hovered.  Maybe next time I will have someone who seems as though they care about their customers more than the money and will take care of their tables.  Food was good and hot however and that's the only reason for the 3 stars for my visit today.

Went there with my friends the appetizers  Wings really suprise me on how wingdelisious hot crispy the sauce on point , double bacon cheeseburger it was good 5 stars for my first time trying it definitely will be back  The young lady  that help us out DAKOTA was very nice 5 stars she definitely show us shes happy in her job and made us feel good a happy employee shows how good the company is

I love Red Robin. Every time I come here, I get my usual. Royal Red Robin burger with mustard added and cheddar cheese, fries with extra ranch and a raspberry limeade. I went on Monday 8/30 with my friend. Our server* started out great! He was friendly and attentive. He frequently checked on us and was very smiley. I don't know what happened, but the service went downhill after the first 25 minutes. After our food was brought, I started eating my burger and noticed it had American cheese instead of cheddar cheese. I couldn't get our server's attention at all, and a manager finally noticed me and brought me the correct burger. After that, we barely saw him for the rest of our visit. It was really strange. We still tipped 25% because RR is our favorite restaurant- this was just an off visit I guess. *I do remember our server's name and at first did mention it, but I edited it out because he may just have been having an off day.

Worst customer service. First off we told host we would be in the restroom so he wouldn't skip us and yet he did so we had to wait longer than the 15 min we were told we would have to wait. Then next we finally got seated n they took another 15 min to get acknowledged to take our order for just drinks. We placed our order and waited another 15minutes to get our food and they messed up my order so they had to take it back. They tried making it up with extra fries but we waited so long. Then we couldn't pay on the little ziosk because our order wasn't placed in there. Never coming here again

Amazing service. Amazing food. We didn't get her name but we think she has an Australian accent I'm not sure but she attended us great. First timers at this red Robbins and it was so good. Probably come again next time

Horrible Service..the waiter in the bar area..it was so bad I wanted to not even pay for my food and walk out. Food was decent. I and everyone around me just hated the waiter..poor attentiveness, didnt ever ask me if I needed anything, didnt even know they offered garlic fries as an option for me, they didnt even bring out a second serving of fries when i asked them to. The guy should just get fired im very displeased..

If you like burgers, this is the place to go! I have tried many of their burgers and they are all great. I recently got a Whisky River BBQ burger. I absolutely loved every bite. It had a big juicy patty on lettuce, tomato, and shoestring onions. I added pickles and it comes with a special BBQ sauce and mayonnaise. I asked to substitute onion rings instead of fries. The best onion rings ever. I got it all free because I have a reward account where every tenth burger is free. Can't beat that!

Review is on restaurant/service. Food was ehh....just ok. Normally I usually don't go to Red Robin because of the kid factor (not hating on kids) but we tried it out again anyways. I's not sure about other locations but this one has gone downhill. My theory is that because it is so close to Victoria Gardens and the surrounding businesses, that they don't try as hard because they know that the foot traffic will be there.  When will hostesses figure it out that people do not like to be seated near the entrance, kitchen or bathrooms. Yeah, I really want a blast of cold air whenever the front door is opened, conversation from the kitchen or the smell of farts when I'm eating. I get that you have to use all available space to maximize your seating area, but c'mon, especially when there are other available seats. If its based off of rotation of the servers then ask the customer if its ok before you walk them to the table.  When we finally got a table the waitress asked if we had been there before. We said "yes" and then she said "So you know how to use our touchscreen orders?" Um, no. She ran through it. Basically, its there to make her job easier but its portrayed as quicker service because you're doing the ordering. Main entrees are ordered through your server, but all appetizers, shakes, and alcohol are ordered through the touchscreen and are delivered by the kitchen/bar. So basically, your server is only responsible for taking your main order, bringing your main order, and refilling your soda/tea/water (which I had to ask for a refill from the barback who brought our appetizer)....so you basically never see them again. You even pay and tip through the touchscreen. And also, clean the damn thing!!! Ours had food on it and it looked like it was cleaned with a burger wrapper it had so much grease on it.  We will not be darkening this doorway ever again.

Now I understand why this place has so many poor reviews for service. My daughters and I ate here last night. Our original sever (older bald gentleman) was very pleasant but informed us he would be going on his lunch and that another gentleman would be taking over, however original server continued to serve the table directly next to us the remainder of our visit. I thought it was odd, but we ordered and received our food in a timely manner. The fried pickle nickels were delish, the cod and shrimp duo tasted like old grease and my daughter enjoyed her veggie burger. Our replacement waiter (younger Asian guy with man bun) was cordial but inattentive. We had no napkins no refills no "how is everything" nada. Meanwhile original waiter dude is going out of his way checking on the table next to us though he was supposedly on lunch. When I finally got a hold of our waiter I politely asked for napkins and the check which someone else brought to us. I paid and tipped and as I'm walking out I hear our waiter complaining to another server to which she responds "yeah you gotta rush them out and be like 'anything else???'" If I didn't have my kids with me I would have addressed this with the manager but instead shook my head and left. The 1 star is literally for the fried pickle nickels. I really hope management addresses customer service with the staff.

This particular Red Robin is just not at the same level as others I have been too. I don't know if it is because this seems to be a very busy location or if it is just not as good as the other locations. The fries are just not as good. They have a weird texture. I gave them three stars because the employees are all super nice and helpful!  Service wise this place is pretty good!

We've dined at Red Robin in Sherwood (and others in CA, AZ, ID) many times. It's a favorite dining spot with family. The food usually pleases everyone, although the service is hit or miss. If possible, we enjoy sitting in the bar area, because the servers oftentimes seem more attentive. We've had a few dinners where member's food restrictions were either not taken seriously, or the servers did not pay close attention - meals had to be sent back several times. The restrooms haven't been as clean as I prefer at a restaurant on several occasions and I brought it to the attention of the server, host or manager. Even with those shortcomings, there's always something that everyone in our family is happy to order, whether it be a selection that is gluten free, dairy free or vegan. We will continue to eat at Red Robin!

Ive always loved Red robin burgers! No matter which location, I never seem to be disappointed. We went on Memorial day to the Rancho Cucamonga location and it was pretty bad. I don't think they prepared themselves to be busy that day which is understandable. However, it took about 30 minutes to be seated, 5 minutes to be introduced to our waiter, and almost another ten minutes before we were asked what we would like to drink. It took about 25 minutes for our food to come out. I order the red tavern burger which I always get. I was so surprised on how horrible it tasted! The bread was soggy and old. Highly disappointed!

Told us it was a 25 minute wait. Waited about 20 minutes and checked in. I was then told we had about a 30 minute wait left. ?? Not cool when waiting with 2 toddlers who are starving. Not to mention, we were waiting near the kitchen. There was 3 empty tables in front of us the entire wait. We ended up walking out.

If you want more then a fast food burger then you found the right place. Burgers are huge and loaded with flavor. Their burgers are served with steak fries and you can get all the fries you can eat. They provide sauces so if you want more then ketchup not a problem just ask your server. Place is great for kids as well, menu has variety for the little ones. My favorite burger is Burnin' Love. They offer a variety of burgers for all palates. Their onion rings are very good as well. I tried their fried nickel pickles, I felt they were a little to salty for me but if salt is your thing then there worth trying.

Came here on a Thursday night and had the worse service ever! Forget about getting bottomless fries! Waitress came 15 minutes after finishing my burger asking if our food came out I replied "yes, can I please have more fries?" she said "of course" waiting another 25 minutes and still no fries or refills on drinks. Ended up paying through the kiosk and left.

Just had dinner here with my family for my mother in laws birthday! JOHN WAS AMAZING!!!!! Attentive, kind, professional and so damn sweet! I wish there were more people like him in the world! John deserves every opportunity and pay raise from Red Robin! He is what it's all about! Making the experience memorable in a meaningful way! Thank you John from the bottom of our hearts for making my family and I feel welcomed and happy! Any employer is lucky to have him! Hands down just a wonderful human being!!!!! Treat him well Red Robin!

Skip it, just take your money to Slater's. It's right across the street and it's FAR beyond just a simple "Better". Or you can also take it to Fuddruckers by Ontario Mall, which has a self-serving condiment bar and you don't have to pay tips. The only pros of Red Robin's is the unlimited fries. Gave 2 stars just to be fair because if the rating is solely on the dish I had, it'll be a pathetic -10. Well, a flat 0 for sure. Ordered the value double tavern burger or whatever it's called. WORST burger I've ever ingested in my life. Put it in a very simple comparison, it's the quality of a McDouble disguised as some gourmet restaurant burger. In fact, I MUCH MUCH MUUUUUCH rather take 2 McDouble for $2.50 than one sloppy soggy nonsense for $6.99.  Okay, allow me to explain why the burger was a flat 0 for me. Let's start with the lesser of the evils. 1st, sauce, personally I don't enjoy it, it's not much different than mayonnaise. If it's served in a modest amount it wouldn't bother me, but the whole burger was soaked in it and that leads to another catastrophe which will be covered last. 2nd lettuce, remember those dollar burger you get from either McDonald's or Burger King? Those shredded lettuce? That's fine and all, but when soaked with the overwhelming amount of weird sauce, it just adds to the mess. 3rd, meat patty. FLAVORLESSSSSSSSS. Again, freaking McDouble's frozen patties are more FLAVORED than this. So lastly, the buns. IDK what it is but it felt like it was the cheapest sesame buns that even Walmart doesn't dare to sell. By the second bite, it had already become a bunch of soggy mess. Just imagine dipping cotton candy in a glass of water. Like that episode of Cutthroat Kitchen where they put the judges on the competing floor and Jet Tila had to serve his sandwich with water soaked buns. I don't know who's recipe of burger that is, DISGUSTING. Flavorless is one thing but man, by the 3rd bite everything was soaked into a giant saucy mess. I get it, it's the cheapest dish of yours, but I much rather take that $7 bucks for a ButteryJack from Jack in the Box. That would've been WAYYYYYYY NICER than this tavern double soggy crap. Alright, done venting about the burger. The rest of the restaurant experience was pretty good. Service was good and the unlimited garlic fries were the star of the dish. My gf's burger was also MEH. Granted, either of us order their gourmet or signature burger and we've had it in the past which weren't bad. But with the same price, I'll GLADLY take it to Slater's right across the street or Fuddruckers which we frequent. The fries were amazing, but it's just like Kirlin, the strongest human but an insignificant shrimp fighting against Freeza/Cell/Boo, couldn't save the day.

Had a party of 30 last night...waitress who served us was so on the ball!!! I mean she was great..polite, accommodating and friendly. I had a waffle chicken sandwich...man was it good! Chicken was huge, super tender and that sweet spicy sauce complimented it perfectly. Husband's big piggy tavern was delicious as well..he liked the garlic fries and Unlimited Rootbeer floats with it too. OVERALL great service great friends great meal!

I'm a huge fan of red robin. I come here at least once a month because the burgers are so good. My favorite are the whiskey river burger and the royal burger which has an over easy egg, when you bite into it all the yummy,gooey yolk soaks the bun and gives the burger so much flavor. The fries wow so good. the onion rings and mozzarella sticks are a great way to start your meal. The mozzarella sticks are the best I have had anywhere. If you're not in the mood for a burger I would recommend the bbq chicken wrap with onion straws.  Customer service is as good a their burgers.

Not happy with the food, can tell it's very cheap quality.  The chicken taste like it's fake and was frozen. The tempora broccoli was absolutely disgusting. Also paid $7 for the artichoke dip and it was so tiny it was nothing but a plate full of chips! My kids didn't want to eat their food. Never going back!

The service was pretty bad. Our server was pretty passive aggressive, or just had this annoyed attitude. I get it, service jobs can be pretty frustrating, but don't show it. It makes the dining experience quite uncomfortable. Only came around once or twice to ask for drink and french fry refills, and forgot to bring them for about 10 minutes. Also, charging for grilled onions? Seriously? Sounds a bit insane just to put some onion you already have chopped onto a grill you already have hot and ready. Overall, a pretty mediocre experience. Food was alright too. Not terrible just alright. Will give this place the benefit of the doubt that it was just a bad day but won't be coming back anytime soon.

if you want a variety of burgers this is your place, i have many favorites and their onion tower rings are delish. if the wait is to long we (my husband and i) always get offered to sit at the bar. they have table tops in the bar area and the servers are on point and very friendly. no matter what time of day you go you will always be able to get a spot pretty quick with really great service.

Ugh....Why did I let my kids bring me back here??? The service is the worst!! It took 30 minutes for anyone to even greet us and get our drink orders. We actually didn't even have a server! It was like everyone was helping us out of desperation! Please don't seat is unless you are able to serve us. I'm sorry, but the food isn't that good to be coming back or putting up with this kind of service. I can keep going, but I think you get the point.

We decided to grab lunch on Memorial Day with the hopes there wouldn't be a long wait.  With my recent diagnosis of MANY food allergies, I am limited on the foods I can eat, especially in a restaurant.   We only had less than a five minute wait until we were seated at a table.  Taylor was our server.  I hate being that pain the butt customer that has to ask what is in everything, but unfortunately I have to ask.  I asked Taylor if they had an allergy menu.  He quickly brought me the facility's  IPad, and showed me their interactive menu.  I basically put in what I'm allergic to (it didn't have all the options on there but the important ones were), and the menu shows what I can order and the things I have to ask to have it without.     Any questions I had, Taylor was eager to answer or provide me with the correct answer.  He explained that they have separate utensils, and cutting boards for people with allergies and special dietary needs.  They also prepare it in a separate area, that way there is no concern for cross contamination.  When I ordered, he asked what the list was of the items I was allergic to, and it was a long list and he wrote them all down.  He gave it to the manager and the manager prepared my meal.   My meal came out wonderfully, and this is the first time I have eaten out without having a reaction since my allergy diagnosis.  Thank you Taylor and Red Robin Staff for making sure I had a good meal, and for not for one second making me feel like I was asking too much!!! Thank you!

On other occasion's there staff is always rude , lazy and have bad attitudes!! They clearly don't care for there customer service. Go to San Dimas red robin there staff, food and service is amazing!!

For as constantly busy as this place is service and food are great! My boyfriend loves coming here for the burning love burger. He always tries different spicy burgers wherever we go but just prefers red robin! I like the Ensenada platter of two grilled chicken breast with side salad with baja ranch! Wait time for food isn't long plus AYCE steak fries!  Happy hour here is mon-fri  (3-6/8-close)with domestic drafts, house wine, or well drinks 2.50!

This is my go to burger place by my work, I can't believe I never reviewed it. I have pretty much all good things to say about Red Robin. The service is always good. It's one of the only restaurants I can say have never made me sick (they take gluten free seriously, which I appreciate). I eat at this location on my lunch hour usually. I sit in the bar and I'm always in and out with plenty of time. The few time I have had issues, which have all been minor (forgetting a burger topping), the staff has always been helpful in resolving the situation immediately. The food is the star and I have never received a poor quality item. I usually order burgers on a gluten free bun, which is probably Udi's but they are never hard or super dry like some places. My only gripe is that they don't have a physical or easily accessed gluten free menu, they give you an iPad which is sometimes in use elsewhere. I usually just end up accessing it on my phone. The good part is that menu is super detailed about what I can and can't have which makes ordering easy.
Richard was awesome fast server had a great attitude. Food was great. Loved the environment, very lively.
First off the Host Greeted us so nicely I knew it was going to be a great meal. Then came Mackenzie!! LOVE HER!!!!!burgers were great fries were ok.. But the service made it 5 star

So our service was great. Our server Eric was great. Very attentive but not annoying.  The food. So disappointed.  I ordered the crispy chicken salad and it was fine.  But my husband ordered wings and he asked for fries instead of chips and of course that didn't happen. So they brought him so fries and they were undercooked. Whoever made the wings didn't mix the sauce well. The wings hardly had any sauce on them.  We loved our server but the cooks need to get their crap together.
Don't know what they did here, but greatly improved. Not blaming the kitchen now. Taking care of business. The place has many more tables occupied and turning now too. SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVED.

Consistently good burgers and chicken sandwiches. Great prices too. Can't think of a better place to please the children and adults alike. I asked a waiter one time to surprise me with whatever her favorite sandwich was, substitutions and everything allowed. She surprised me with the bruschetta chicken sandwich, sub the chicken patty for a crispy chicken patty add buzzard sauce. Dear lord it was delicious. Reminded me when i was working in restaurants and we always tried different substitutions because we would get sick of the menu items. Her sandwich became my wifes, my sons, and my favorite sandwich. wish i could remember her name so i could give her a shout out right now  :) - as long as you know what you're walking into, red robin will never let you down
I love that they have a chicken platter with a salad that is only 6 to 9 points on weight watchers and it fills you up.  The food was good but as usual with red robin can be expensive.
Chili Chili Cheeseburger taste great. Fantastic service. Seated fast for Sunday lunch.
Loved the service today. Great tasting burger and steamed veggies. I also enrolled in the RR Royalty rewards. Everyone should.

Ok, I am reviewing Red Robin again. After my first review, I was contacted by a Red Robin Regional Manager who apologized for the bad service, sent me a gift card and suggested that I give the Rancho Cucamonga location another try. For this, I say "Thank you Red Robin for taking the time to follow up on your bad Yelp reviews".  This is really what spurred me to being writing reviews. That and we want to share some of the really good places we have visited. After some time, my wife and I decided to try Red Robin again. We went back to the Rancho location as we were in the mood to "pig out" and relax.  We tried the Towering Onion Rings, as we are big fans of really good onion rings and we were not disappointed. They were great! For dinner we wanted to try the Tavern Double Burger with unlimited steak fries. The burgers were delicious but a bit on the small side. Thus the price of $6.99. We did have several orders of the delicious steak fries, although the wait was a little on the long side for them. Over all, the food was really, really good. We enjoyed it. It was what we came here to have and enjoy. We did find their beer list a bit on the limited side. We don't drink, Coors, Bud, Miller, ect and prefer beer with some taste like those of a good Micro Brew. Blue Moon and Sam Adams will suffice, but we are really looking for more taste.  We started out in the bar as Red Robin was fairly busy at 6pm on a Saturday evening.  The bar service was good as we watched the hockey game while waiting for our table. We were shown to our table about 30 min later where we had adequate service. Nothing out of the ordinary, but nothing special either. There were many, many empty tables and thought we could have been seated earlier, but who knows. Customer service is a BIG issue with us. We did not have any major problems, like before, but we do find Red Robin to be a bit on the loud side. For the type of family restaurant that Red Robin is, I am not surprised but would have liked to not to have yell my conversation at my wife. Would I return to Red Robin...........yeah I think I will. We really did enjoy our food and did have a nice evening after a long day of grocery shopping.

Put our name in for a party of 5. Told us it'd be 40 minutes. Ok, fine. Waited 40 minutes, one group is called, another group is called. Then another. So at the 50 minute mark I ask where we are on the list and am told, "You were on the list, sorry, looks like someone took you off the list." Then they tell is they'll add us to the list again and it'll be another 30 minutes. Nope. Bye.

I have GOT to be Red Robin's biggest fan. The best part about Red Robin is, hands down, the ENDLESS GARLIC FRIES. Yes, you can substitute the regular steak fries for garlic fries. And yes, it's like a dollar and change more, but it's endless (so are the regular steak fries). Let that soak in your mind real quick: ENDLESS. GARLIC. FRENCH. FRIES. Gourmet Cheeseburger ($9.49) The burger is super simple. That doesn't mean the burgers are plain by any means. They have a huge variety of different burgers, but I like the simple one. They don't cook it any lower than Medium which I don't really like, but the burgers still taste great.

This place  was horrible this visit my last two visits have been really bad and I've had the same server help me he works in the bar area and has a big beard And works behind the bar as well he seems very spread thin the first time I was enjoying my meal inside and the service was the worst it's ever been The last time I ordered takeout they told me to be there in 15 minutes I showed up 20 minutes later only to have the same guy with the beard tell me my food was 20 minutes from being finished and I explained to him how they set up ready in 15 minutes and he said at least you know when you get it that night they had him running into the bar area and behind the bar it was a very busy night I feel like this piece is understaffed oh more than likely be attending a different red Robin location from now on

I cant help it... I LOVE Red Robin. We always start out with the Buffalo Wings... Red Robin has my favorite Buffalo Wings. Maybe about a year or so ago (maybe longer) they started serving them on a bed of potato chips... and my wife and I LOVE this. There is nothing better than a crunchy potato chip with buffalo sauce on it! So much more satisfying than the standard carrots and celery. We always get a little extra buffalo sauce on the side as well...  As for the burger, I keep it simple. I've ventured out and tried a few different things, and I always come back to the original... the Gourmet Cheeseburger. I'm kind of particular about my cheeseburgers, so I don't really care for too much frill... So, I order the Gourmet, monster (2 patties), with American cheese (because nothing melts like American cheese), and I hold the onion, tomato and relish. It is pretty darn close to the perfect burger... it is fantastic... every... time. Lately, my wife and I end up eating in the bar. We either belly up to the bar or we sit in one of the booths in the bar. We don't like the high tops in the bar because quite frankly they are just TOO close together. They may as well have one long cafeteria style table and let people pull up a chair, because you're all sitting shoulder to shoulder anyhow.  Aside from that, we like the bar area because Helen is usually working, and she is awesome. We hope that they keep her where she is and give her a raise... because it would be a shame to lose service that good to management. She always has an awesome attitude and just provides excellent, attentive service every time. We dont always get her as our server unless we belly up, but we always get great service when we do.   There is a gentleman (who's name I don't know) who is often serving in the bar area. As far as attitude goes... he's an A+ all the way, but unfortunately, its also his downfall... he spends so much time talking to the customers that the service ends up being slow and the food/drinks take longer to get. Overall, however, I give RR in Rancho 5 stars... I love it here. Its a casual atmosphere where you can get an awesome burger and wings.  Honestly, I went to Slater's 50/50 across the way ONE time. Dont get me wrong... Slater's is great. But there is no reason to wait 2 hours when you can get a delicious (and quite possibly better) burger at Red Robin and maybe wait 10 minutes.

Update : A few months ago, I visited this Red Robin (on foothill in Rancho Cucamonga). It was not a great experience and I left an honest review on Yelp. To my surprise, I was contacted by a representative from Red Robin and given a gift card to try the restaurant again.  So, tonight, we decided to give it a shot.  I am SO HAPPY to report that we had an awesome experience. I did not tell anyone that I had a gift card from Yelp until the very end because I wanted an honest experience. Our server Derek was amazing. Last time we had an issue with our drinks, this time Derek was so on top of it that almost as soon as our bottomless float was finished, he was ready with another. Our food came out quickly and was delicious. I had the new Bonzai salad, which was delicious. And this time, we stayed for dessert too. We loved our mud pie! I am glad that we gave it another shot, and more glad that not only did we not experience the issues we had last time, but Derek actually exceeded our expectations. Thank you Katie A for listening to us and giving us a chance to rectify our opinion.
