Previous Review: I have always loved Red Robin, so please note that this review is based on my experience at the Rancho Cucamonga Red Robin.  For fairness sake, I'll state that we did arrive at 7:30 on a Saturday night, so naturally, it was busy.  However, the host sat us, and told us our server, David, would be right over. He wasn't. He showed up about 10 minutes later, took our drink orders and appetizer orders. About 20 minutes later, I flagged him down and asked about our drinks. He looked at our table in disbelief as he realized he has completely forgotten our drinks. I also took this opportunity to ask for napkins and silverware and place our dinner orders. About 5 minutes later, he appeared with the 3 root beer floats Tim and the kids had ordered, but the older 2 kids and I were just brought empty glasses. When I asked why the 3 glasses on the tray were empty, David explained he had to go make the lemonades. Seriously? Just bring me my lemonade! Meanwhile, our appetizers were being delivered. And the guy delivering our appetizers tried to take away the tray of empty glasses. He was startled when I took the tray out of his hands and explained those weren't empty, they had yet to be filled. I finished my appetizer just as my lemonade was arriving. At this point we had 3 empty bottomless rootbeer floats at the edge of the table. They were ignored.  At 9pm, we still hasn't had any drink refills, nor had our server checked in on us. We decided maybe we should just leave. In retrospect, we all agree we should have.  Instead, we flagged down our server, pointed out how many people who had come after us were down leaving and we still had no food. He went to check on the food, which he said would be 3 more minutes. He then explained that this was his first shift and he was sorry he was messing up so badly.  7 minutes later our lukewarm soggy food was delivered. My guess is had been sitting under a heat lamp for the last 30 minutes.  The manager came over to talk to us, but literally did nothing. Personally, I feel he should have at least comped our bottomless drinks which were each refilled once in an hour and a half.  We barely ate any of our very sub par food, before paying our bill and leaving only a $1 tip, which frankly, I thought was over generous given that we paid over $100 for this disaster of a meal.  My tip to Red Robin is this: servers probably shouldn't start on a Saturday night dinner rush. And if guests pay for bottomless floats or lemonades, and your staff doesn't actually deliver bottomless drinks, you shouldn't charge them for them.  And lastly, the floor managers need to be aware of what's happening on the floor. The manager should have noticed the 6 empty glasses at the edge of the table, even if the server didn't. He has to be especially aware if the server is brand new.  This trip to Red Robin definitely left us with a bad taste in our mouth, and it may be a while before we return.

A cozy place, at the beginning it looks like any other sports bar and then you go inside and it looks like any other franchise diner.  You have to try their towering onion rings as a started, that's what they famous for. I ordered a black and bleu burger! That's their new burger in the house and it worth it!  One of the cool things about this place bottomless fries! That's right! You can eat fries! How can you pass on that! The staff is really friendly and the place is not that loud which gives you the chance to actually have a conversation with your friends over dinner!

Although I've driven past this restaurant for many years, I've never eaten here until today.  I was here on a winter afternoon & it was packed!  It's similar to Applebee's.  There's an extensive menu with many tempting dishes. I tried the turkey burger and to my surprise, it was good!  Usually, if restaurants have turkey burgers, the meat patty itself is so flavorless and it depends on the other ingredients put on the burger to make it taste halfway OK, but no, this turkey patty in itself had great seasoning!  However, I've had better artichoke, spinach cheese dip.  My boyfriend said his bacon, cheeseburger was good...not bad, but not spectacular.

One of the worst experience I've ever had .We went to eat for my son birthday and you expect a better service than the regular basic burger place example (jack in the box,Burger king,McDonald's don't Even talk about CARL'S JR at Carl's they at least bring your food on time .We ordered the food and drinks they brought the drinks right a way.I ordered a ice tea guess what no sugar my wife's soda was flat I asked the waitress for both things guess what NEVER GOT THEM .The food came and guess again No napkins but you know what my wife got a huge hair coming out of the burger she tried to pull it out and it was incrusted in the center of the beef patty I asked for the manager ASAP, we showed it to her and said sorry and she offered to give us desert  No thank you.....Come on people take a stand CARL'S JR your my only friend....

Great burgers. A little upset they changed the recipe of the garlic fries, they switched to more of a seasoning rather than the butter garlic vinergrette they used to use . But Service and seating space is B+ ...

Service is not good here! First we checked in and had to wait 20 minutes for our seats when there were available seats. Service sucks here! Our waiter finally acknowledge us after 15 minutes of us sitting for awhile. However love the burgers and endless fries. Probably will try another location for service.

I love Red Robin! My family and I always have a great time here. I've been many times but today our service deserves a review. Our waiter Bruce D. was awesome and needs kudos for his customer service. He had a great balance of checking on our table and never left us needing to ask for a refill. Will definitely be coming back soon and hope Bruce helps us again!

I guess I visited here when things just couldn't go right. It was pretty crowded, so we decided to go to the bar, where there is open seating. There were some seats together at the bar, but they were at a low bar and were in a high traffic area, so we went to the higher section of the bar, where we couldn't find two seats together. So, we settled into a booth in the bar, where the manager promptly told us that the booths in the bar were not available to us. He found a high-top table that worked for us. Fourth time's a charm, I guess. After we FINALLY found seating, it took forever for the server to get to us to take our order or even get us water. I ordered a burger without a bun and a side caesar salad. She brought the salad out first, which was very nice. But, she didn't bring any silverware. It took so long for her to get us silverware that I decided to eat the salad with my fingers. Hey, you've got to do what you've got to do. They were a little heavy-handed on the salad dressing, so I couldn't eat it. When my burger came out, it had a leaf of lettuce underneath it that was actually rotting and they put my burger in a basket. I guess they thought I was going to eat a meat patty with my fingers, too. I had to ask for a plate. Also, there were fries as my side with the burger. So, she had charged me for a caesar salad instead of substituting it as my side. My dining partner always gets his burger lettuce wrapped. Other Red Robins wrap theirs in iceberg lettuce, but this Red Robin wraps in Romaine ?!?!? It was awkward. So, we had a free burger on our rewards card, but we didn't want to use it. Our server said we had to use it or not use our rewards card for the purchase, which is a weird system. But, oh well.  Anyway, it's a very inconsistent experience than I've had at other Red Robins. I guess there are days like that.

My Bf and I ate dinner here tonight at it was such a good experience. The onion rings were crispy, came out fast, and were delicious as usual. Our server, Richard, did such a good job of checking on us and being personable. I can't remember the last time I ate out where the server actually left me with an impression. I honestly thought service wouldn't be as punctual since we sat in the bar area but I was pleasantly surprised. Our food was delicious and came out in good time. Very happy with the whole experience.

The food is Red Robin food, you either like it or you don't, I like it. We came here on a Friday night, and sat on the patio to avoid a long wait. Our server Steve was really friendly got us our food quickly and kept our drinks full.

This place has really turned things around for the better. The service is once again as great as it was in years past. No more must we wait so long for bottomless fries refills (get the campfire sauce) and the staff are once again friendly and cheerful. The food orders come to the table hot and as ordered. Plenty of TVs around, and the bar area is great. This restaurant has been added back to my top 5 for football nights and weekends. I can now recommend you visit here often.

This is a pretty great location. I think what was most fun was the fact that Albert Einsteins picture was right above me and I couldn't stop giggling at it. Like Johnny Rockets, I appreciate Red Robin having a vegan burger available. The servers were very kind here, the place was clean and overall I had a positive experience!

Dang....horrible experience and I love Res Robin. So we got there at 4:00 pm, the hostess said it would be a 15 minute wait. So I went to the bathroom and looked around and noticed that half the table were open. So I thought they are probably short staffed which isn't my problem but whatever. 20 minutes later we got our table. We were greeted quickly and placed our drink order and ordered the chile queso as an appetizer. It came quickly and we were impressed, however barely any chips came with it. We placed our order, talked watched a little tv and began to see people that sat down way after is were getting there food. The waitress stopped by about 3x to tell us that our food was almost ready. Well it finally came about 5:45, yes we sat down at 4:20. Both burgers were cold and the French fries were cold and getting hard from being cold. We didn't send it back because I know what happens when food gets sent back. Horrible service and the waitress didn't even offer to take off the appetizer or offer a free desert, she just acted like nothing happened. Won't go back to this location. Total disappointment. One star only because I feel sorry for the waitress. Oh and don't get me started in the bathroom....Yikes

I feel kinda gross giving red robin a 5 star.  but the fact is i keep going back so it'd be unfair to give it any less. i love burgers, so i'm always down to go to red robin.  i also love fries, so of course i appreciate the unlimited fries. the burgers are good, although a little bit pricey.  the portion is very generous, and they give free refill on non-soda drinks.  i've always been a fan of the freckled lemonade because i like eating the strawberries.  my brother discovered their root beer float is also refillable and was in heaven. the service is up and down.  but i don't usually care too much about service when i'm eating burgers and fries.  i like that they're not stingy about refills and they even let me take the refills to go when i don't finish. my favorite is the burning love, because i like the jalapeno peppers.  the mushroom one is always very tasty.  there are SO MANY choices though i'm sure everyone can find one that is their favorite. the atmosphere seems very family friendly, and i also see a lot of bday celebrations there too.   i also like that they have a good loyalty membership program.  i've gotten free burgers for my bday, and from accumulating points (which is loaded on your card electronically, you don't have to carry a stamp card).

Came in just for lunch. I sat at the bar as usual. Very cool & friendly bartender. I got the red and blu salad buy had them add crispy buffalo chicken, delicious!!!! I didn't have my I'D so sadly no drinks for me :( I'll take it as a compliment! Overall great experience food came out fast and I will definitely be coming back!

I came here with my daughter and got food to go got home in time for my son to eat before work finding the order all wrong called to get it remade and when I got there the bartender wanted me to pay again I stood around 20 minutes while they ran around trying to find a manager to vold so drawer not short but my son didn't get to eat he had to leave !!!! Terrible no one was even in this place the bar was dead.

Well, we thought we would give this one more college try and we were let down again.  We had the burger and chicken wrap.  The BBQ sauce was overwhelming and once again, the fry's were undercooked and give Ore Ida a good name.  It really is a joke.  Cooked food is very easy to distinguish from non cooked food.  Why is it so hard to cook a french fry?  Also, again, for the price that you pay for a roll of the dice for burgers, IN N Out is still the go to burger establishment.  Red Robin lost a few more clients.  Disappointing.

Stopped by this location on our way to Chatsworth & we had amazing service from Stephanie. She was so friendly, efficient & returned to our table throughout our meal to make sure we were doing okay. Even upon bringing a wrong drink to our table, she apologized & promptly brought back the right one back. If we ever stop around this area on our way, it's because of the great first experience!

3 stars is because of the customer service. We went in Sept 2014, and i constantly had to flag someone dowm every time we needed something. It took 15min for our waitress to ask us for our drinks and by the time she did, i told her i already flagged someome down and gave them my order request. Im not the most patieny customer when the place is practically empty, yet we have to wait for service. I saw her again when it was time to pay. Still, having to flag dowm others as they walked by for napkins, refills, etc.
I love red Robin we come here often. The food is great I've never had any issues with the food quality however the place is kind of small and the hosts tend to be a bit rude from time to time

Used to visit this Red Robin VERY often for family dinners. Two visits after their remodel were very disappointing so we hadn't been back until tonight. The food was great and our server Devin was awesome! We just became loyal customers once more thanks to her great service.

Despite the fact that my wife really likes this place, all I can justify giving it is two stars.  It seems like every time we are there we get less than stellar service.  This last time, the guy that ran our food to our table actually took care of us better than our actual server, who was MIA most of the meal.          The food is decent, and their burgers are tasty, but everyone that knows me knows I can't stand crappy service.  We will probably go here again, but if the service continues to head downhill, I will ammend my rating to a one star.  When my jack and coke needs a refill, don't keep me waiting!

The all you can eat fries is a great deal. But what did it for me was the royal burger, cooked medium with a sunny side up egg on top.  It's a bit pricey when you add a coke and tip at 17.00. But overall it's a good clean place for lunch.
Most of the time i enjoy the new menu items, but sometimes not happy about what gets taken off!

Had the guacamole bacon burger.  Quite honestly.   Farmers boys farmer burger is much much better.  Wife had the bruschetta chicken burger and that was good.  Onion rings are good.  Steak fries need some help

I have eaten here a couple of times and in my opinion their burgers are not much better than a fast food restaurant.   Wendy's, In/Out, and so many other make better burgers.  I do like the fries and the full bar but that is pretty much it.  I had great customer service 3/4 visits and probably will come back since my kids enjoy the kids menu.

Came here on a busy Saturday afternoon, the place was packed, and it took about 10 minutes to get a table. I checked out their limited beer selection it, about 6 different beers I went with a Blue Moon 22 ouncer it was about 5 bucks. They do have a full bar, which was pretty sweet, the gf ordered the Ultimate Margarita that had Grand Marnier in it, she liked it, I took a sip and it was pretty good. I ordered the Burnin' Love Burger medium rare  $9.29 and I highly recommend it, it had crispy-fried jalapeño rings, tangy salsa, spicy Pepper-Jack cheese, and chipotle mayo. She ordered the Bleu Ribon Burger $9.79  that had a tangy steak sauce, topped with crumbled Bleu cheese, and thin crispy onion rings. She really like bleu cheese, I tried hers, it was good, but not as good as mine. They both came with bottomless fries which was a good thing because there are hardly any when you get your burger, we ordered 2 extra baskets all warm and fresh but on there bomb ass seasoning salt and enjoyed. This was my first time going to a Red Robin, and I really enjoyed it, great service, food, and drinks, except for the beer selection.

It's always good food and good service here...my only complaint is that I wish they had more TV's so I could watch the game but that's more my problem than their problem...It is very family-friendly too as this night there were kids everywhere...didn't bother me though, it was nice as my kids were with me too...they have unlimited refill on root beer floats...what?!?!  awesome...

At $15 for their black and blue burger, I was expecting greatness. All I got was meh. I've had better burgers at Carl's for one third the price. The portion size was tiny, the blue cheese was hard to find, their plating was inconsistent (for some reason my plate didn't arrive with the cheese sauce that the others had). The chili I ordered as the side was better than the burger but there wasn't much of that either. I had been to another Red Robin at a different location and my experience was more favorable, but I feel like if you're going to charge three times more for a burger it needs to be three times better and my experience today wildly missed that mark. I don't expect that we will be returning there for lunch any time soon.

Have been to others and this is by far the best!! Brought my boyfriend for the first time and he loved it! The service was really great from the moment we walked in & it was a very busy hour. Our food was ready on time and super delicious!! Will be coming back for sure!

I heard about the bottomless fries & I knew I had to go that same day to go try them! The restaurant said it closes at 10 & I got there around 8:30 plenty of time for me to sit down & eat my meal.  As I was walking in the door I made eye contact with the host. I smiled & she completely walked away from me & my party of one. So we waited about 10 minuets until someone els came & sit us down.  Now this person that sat us down was very kind  but seemed like they didn't know much because they sat us down where there were no other people around & right next to the door where the kitchen is at. Then we asked if we could be seated in another area & they said that all other areas were closed for the night because it had already been cleaned.  We said ok then we will just stay here. So we waited for our waiter to come & ask us if we wanted drinks & I saw every person in that restaurant walk past us & not say a word. Until the waitress that had passed by me about 6 came & asked if we wanted a drink when I asked for my drink she said that they had a limited about of drinks available because the restaurant was closing soon.  By this time I didn't even want to eat there anymore & was annoyed at how unorganized this restaurant was. I left sad & upset & decided to go eat across the street.  I decided to visit this location one more time & this visit was much better than the previous one.  I have to say my waitress was very amazing her name was Jessica. She was attentive & very kind. I'm glad I decided to visit this location one more time, but I would want the same person to be my server.
great food and the service was awesome our sever Bruce was very attentive I will b stopping here more often but all in all I like dis red Robin so enjoy and I hope this helps lol
Good place to go for some good beer and good conversation. And they have Goose Head on tap now that's some good IPA

I don't usually write reviews for chain restaurants, because duh everyone has been to Red Robin. But this particular location is one of the best I've been to. It's huge, so there's never much of a wait. The service is great. Best yet, I love getting salads at restaurants. But I hate missing out on Red Robin's delicious bottomless steak fries that come with burger entrees! The servers here are always more than willing to send over a small basket of fries for me even though I order a salad (my parents always order the burgers and fries). Little things like this make coming here a pleasure.

This place is pretty good. I am a huge burger fan. When i'm here I always get the Swiss mushroom burger and it seems to be perfect every time. Cooked exactly like I ask. Medium rare with a small lean towards medium. I love the fact they have bottomless fries. Especially with the ranch sauce.  Only reason I don't give 5 stars is they need to have a broom ran through there a little more often. There were fries and napkins on the ground and I stepped on what looked like an entire top bun from a burger under our table.

Food is good, but service is anything but good.  It took the server 10 minutes to acknowledge us, when she did come I was ready with our order.  I told her our drink order and started with our appetizer and she told me that she was only taking our drink order for now. Finally we got our food, which was good, but no napkins, knives, sauces.  I felt like everything we kept asking for was an inconvenience for her.  Had to ask for the check and when I asked about the rewards card I had handed her earlier she pulled it out of her apron, never even checked for rewards.  I was done at that point, paid and left.
Just like the other Red Robin's I've been to, this place has excellent customer service, the food is consistently good and it's relatively cheap.

Came with my sister and the babies got to say really nice place,  the host was very nice she seen us with car seats and she opened the door for us. We were seated right away and handed our menus, Kristyn was very nice greeted us and got our drink order right away she suggested appetizers and demonstrated them to me on the menu.  This is my first time here gotta say it was wonderful,  the wrap and chicken tortilla Soup was delish!  Love the onion ring tower that my sister ordered, the strawberry lemonade here is the   lol really strawberries and lemons. This place Is great, really loved how kristyn kept checking up on us, great service nice atmosphere.   Will be coming back.
Great food, great service.  Miss the bottomless Mac-n-cheese for kids though.

I had a great server named Travis very knowledgable , and patience , because I couldn't make up my mind on what alcoholic drink to get . He checked up on us but not too much but enough to make sure everything was going smoothly , thanks Travis for the great dining experience
Absolutely love this place. Service is good and the food is awesome. I order the onion rings and the whiskey river BBQ burger. It's the BEST!!!
Best family resturaunt, but you can still enjoy your beer. The beer is always cold and thr food always on point. I truly recommend it for all the family!

I've been here three times and today by far was the worst experience I have had. The wait wasn't too long but I've waited longer for my food then I did my the damn table. After we ordered, it took 40 minutes to get our food. Once our food came they got our order wrong. So we had to wait another 15 minutes for the food we actually ordered. Max was really helpful though. He was trying to get everything right for us. So thank you to Max. The food was good once we got it but it wasn't worth all that wait. Worst service I've had in a while. So as of today fuck red robin.

They have really good food here, but the service is horrible .  I went on a Sunday afternoon, around 2pm, for lunch and it was crowded. I mean super crowded. We got seated in the bar area, but our waiter totally forgot about us. We were ready to order because my husband and I looked at the menu when we were waiting to get seated. So finally we ordered our food, but it took a long time to get our new order of bottomless fries. So frustrating!!! When the service is super slow makes me not want to give a good tip, just saying! I gave it 3 stars because the food is so good here!!!!
Really enjoy the new remodel of this location. Great service, and delicious burgers! Horray!
Love the chicken with pineapple sandwich and endless fries with the seasoning on the table

Good hamburgers, in my opinion better than slaters 50/50. Good beer prices but they say draft domestic beer is $4.50 for a 22 oz. so I order a hangar 24 on draft and our server says that's not on the domestic prices. I asked aren't they out of Riverside (I already knew the answer), she said yea but we don't put them in the domestic category. I feel if you advertise draft domestic beers $4.50 then they all should be that price.

we love coming here, great food, servers are very friendly and attentive, managers goes around tables and checks on customers, great atmosphere, our server Vanessa ( i think that's her name) so friendly and has beautiful smiles, great job management for hiring the best crew!!

I am giving it two stars because the service is horrible. We use to come here all the time. Yesterday we went for lunch with my family. Our server never once took a dirty plate of empty cup off the table. He never brought refills or really checked on us. It was a disappointing experience. When you eat somewhere and there are appetizers take the dirty dishes away and don't push it out of the way to put more plates down. Other than that the food was pretty good. I am all about customer service so we most likely won't come back.
Very crowded and understaffed. Waiters are overwhelmed and kind of rude. Food was generally OK.

Red Robin always amazes me. I ordered the fish and chips and wow, they just turned out perfect.        Those little fish were so fresh that I thought I had caught them and cooked them to perfection myself.        Soooo cool was when we ordered the tall order of onion rings. It comes out on a pole with 13 onion rings that were real crispy.       Our waitress, Lynda was really great and was quick and very efficient with all our food and drinks.
Had the smoke & pepper burger twice already. Get it before it's gone. We have been here 3 times in the last month , they have done a small remodel , service is better and burgers have been great

Red Robin has become one of our regular places for picking up a weeknight dinner when we are too behind to cook. The last few times that we stayed to eat, we went at an off time since this location seems to always be busy. My wife called in a to go order this past Thursday, and I stopped in to pick it up. It was right at 6:30, and the waiting area was packed! It had been between 15 and 20 minutes since the order was called in, and they brought it right to me when I checked in with the hostess. By the time I got home, the food was still piping hot. I went with a guacamole bacon burger this time. It was good as always. The guacamole was tasty and creamy, and the bacon was nice and crisp. We asked for an extra box of fries because on the to go orders, they are always cheap on the fries. They don't charge you for extra fries, just like in the restaurant, but if you don't ask for another box of fries, you might be disappointed when you get home. I also had to get a mini order of mozerrella sticks, because they are just too good to pass up! I don't know what it is about their batter, they aren't like typical seasoned bread crumbs, but not quite tempura either; it's somewhere in between. The breading is super crispy. I'm not sure what it is, but it's good! Their ranch is delicious too, super fatty and full of buttermilk! Red Robin is always delicious, and we almost always get food to go these days, which also makes it fast and painless. If you are going to dine in, call ahead and see what the wait is like, or make sure that you are not going right at prime eating times.

I Love Red robin I come here all the time but the service today was horriable. When we walked in the girl said it would a 10-15 min wait that turned into 25 mins all the people that came in after us got seated in like 5 mins. When we finally got seated it seemed like it would go by fast we got our drinks and ordered....it took almost 45 mins just to get our food...the people who got seated before us had already eaten and were walking out not to mention they were families not just one or two people. When we recieved the food it was cold and when we asked for hot fries it was like we had to pull teeth....the waitress must have been new or something she didn't know what the hell was going on...everyone elses waiters and waitresses seemed friendly and outgoing bless her it isn't her fault the service sucked...but they took one of the meals off which was nice all in all I love this place can't say I wobt come back but please better service next time!
Clean, smells good (I know that may sound weird, but some places smell! lol), waitress was pleasant and suggested a burger I ended up ordering and loved. Lemonade was yummy!
BEST HAPPY HOUR!!!!! We love this place for Happy Hour and all other times!!!!!  Helen at the bar ROCKS!!!!

What happened to this place, the wait staff used to be friendly and helpful. Now the look like they are running scared. All new mgmt they don't have time for friendliness.We were right in the middle of dinner and our special waitress was gone,we hear she went home,if they let her go we won't be back, Helen is one of your best waitress, don't lose her or I will spread the word BOycot RR, food is so so won't miss it,

If I could give this place no stars, I would. Went there with my boyfriend and we had a gift card so we thought, why not? We were seated immediately and the waitress came right over and got our drinks. Started off well and their new menu looked better from the last time we were there, which was a few years ago. The food came out and now we remembered why we haven't been here in so long. It was the worst meal I have ever had. To be honest I would have rather eaten spam out of a can. The meat literally tasted like it had been sitting in slime for at least a week. Both his and my meal tasted like that. I will never go back to this place solely because of the slop they call food.

Usually I always have the blta croissant. Always yummy. Usually have good service. Sometimes it can be so so depending on business and new servers. Today my fries weren't hot and my moms garden burger was cold. Our server sent it back but the fries were hot but the burger only warm. Still yummy though and will go back

Went there on Saturday night. Had the chicken drumettes and sliced potatoes. I've never had food poisoning until now. Could not even make it through work the next day and had to nurse myself back to health.

Chicken burgers tasted like rubber. Portions were very small and not tasty. Complained of taste of the chicken and got a regular meat burger but still wasn't satisfied. I won't be coming back here. Rather go to eureka burger in Claremont or even hole in the wall burger places. Not very appealing for me!
Busy Sunday night and still out in under an hour and food came out perfect, great service ill be back soon

Had such a great experience here. The burgers were absolutely delicious, everyone in our group enjoyed their food. I love the free refills on fries and root beer floats, you'll always leave full and you can even get the fries as an appitizer which is great especially if you're dining with hungry kids. Our server Devyn was spectacular, she catered to our every need and made sure my family had a great dining experience. I'll defi be coming back here with my family because the kids seem to love it. The only suggestion I would have is to have a better happy hour. Even after the discount the beers seemed the same as a full priced beer. I'm not complaining, I would just become more of a regular if the happy hour was better

I love this place! This is the first restaurant I found that offers Gluten Free buns! I had not had a real burger (lettuce wraps are do not make real burgers) in over 2 years and BAM! Udi's gluten free buns are on the menu and are delicious! I always liked Red Robin, but now that I can have a real burger, bun at all I love the place!

Their Mint Brownie shake is DELICIOUS! not too indulging... Service was great, kids love leaving with a balloon. Burgers are pretty big, but I love their fries and seasoning, the whole atmosphere of the restaurant as well. If you're going in on a Sunday, try getting there before noon! (it gets really busy around 12:30ish)

Great burgers and bottomless fries.... I recently tried a BBQ chicken wrap and it was really good. I normally have the BBQ Burger. That's my usual choice. It's also nice to know dogs are allowed on the patio and they have heat lamps. Sigh up for their club card, they usually have a giveaway a month. ****UPDATE**** They no longer allow dogs on the patio. Won't be back. Off to Lazy Dog Cafe...
My first time visiting a Red Robin. There wasn't anything spectacular about this place that would make me want to come back. The food was just okay but the staff was great.

Came here because my friend was raving about the endless fries, and we were in the area and hungry.  Well, since it's passover, I knew i'd be limited with my choices :(. However, it was still a delicious meal! I was able to get my burger lettuce wrapped (a lot of lettuce too, it actually worked wonderfully) and I guess since I want my burger wrapped in lettuce, I want a side salad instead of fries too. But that's okay, it was a good salad, with pretty good ranch.  My friends seemed to enjoy their endless fries though...Next time, when i can eat bread again, it'll be even more delicious.  And as far as prices go, pretty good! Nothing seemed horribly overpriced, and the burger actually tasted good! I will definitely be back, definitely.
very bad service here from the hostess to our waitress  . endless steak fries were cold had to find manager to get some more our waitess ignoreed us burgers were decent but not worth it

I went to this Red Robin because I usually love their food. But my waitress was very rude. She had no personality and she seemed like she hated working there. When I asked, politely, for some napkins, she rolled her eyes, threw them on the table, and walked away. No response or anything after I said thanks. She never smiled and she took my order as if I was holding a gun to her head. She never came around to ask how I was doing. Also, the food wasn't that great this time. I ordered a chicken salad, which had too much water in it, and a side of fries that looked (and tasted) like they sat on the heater for too long. I would definitely steer clear of this place, thanks to her.

I can never be disappointed in this place. We ended up coming in on a Sunday afternoon and I was a little iffy because I never go out to eat on Sunday afternoons because they're usually so crowded from the church goers. We were fortunate enough to come in on a day that was slow and waited about a minute before we were seated. For some reason we're always seated in the same area, which is right by the kitchen. Some people don't like being seated right by the kitchen because of the chit chat and clatter that goes on because the glass panels, but I don't mind it so much. It allows me to check out the behind the scenes action that goes on.  As soon as we were seated, we were greeted by our server who hastily asked us if we've been there before, "yes" and if we were ready to order, "yes". I guess the service is what's stopping me from giving this place five stars. If I wasn't somewhat of a regular and if I didn't already know what I want, I would be annoyed of how rushed she was. I ordered the Royal Red Robin Burger and the boy ordered the Whiskey River Burger, both cooked as pink as they can get it. They cook them medium but they're usually more on the medium rare side. So if you like your meat well, be sure to tell them that.  Our food arrived soon after we ordered and the fries were piping hot and crispy, just the way I like them. Since they have endless fries, you don't get a lot with the first order but they always promptly refill. The burger was big, juicy and oh so delicious. There's always one way I judge my burgers and it's the amount of cheese paper that I am rewarded with and Red Robin never disappoints. If there's left over cheese, then to me, it's a great burger.  About two bites into our meal, our server went on a lunch break and we were given another server. She was pleasant but if there's one thing that annoys me the most in a restaurant is if I'm rushed out. I wasn't even half way done with my burger yet before she dropped off the check and said, "no rush". Burger in hand, almost ready to take a bite and she comes by and drops the check book off. Yeah, right, no rush... I took my time and she didn't bother us again which was an upside.  Overall, food trumps service.
Not bad, food is always consistent, waiters are very friendly. I like the restaurant itself, the bottomless fries are a plus. It's a nice place to come with friends if you have no where else to be.
Great location to grab a burger, I really enjoy Saturday nights at Red Robin.
SOOOO GOOD Unlimited seasoned fries! Homemade Iced Tea, And the Blue ribbon Burger. This is what I get every time I go in, and this is why I love red Robin!
Wish I can give this a 4 and a half star because they have great and well prepared food and great service but sometimes I don't like the environment but this is a great restaurant

Uh, hoho, Red Robin you've done it now. The food used to be excellent. I came here several years ago when you first opened up, and many many times after that. Recently I wen't about a month ago, and I saw you were under new management! Ha, yeah whoever you are screwed up big time, the food isn't the same. And the Fries!!! Are you serious they taste like the frozen crap that comes in a bag at the store called Ore Ida, they are all thin, and then you give us the small hard pieces. What's with the little can fry cups, what happened to the basket of fries you used to give us, WHY do you people always change $hit and screw everything up!!!!!!!! Everything was fine before you started screwing up. And then, you tried to sit us by the bathroom, and when we wanted to move, you wanted to give us attitude, well I won't be coming back here ever again, I'll go back to my favorite Red Robin in the Irvine Spectrum. And, I really loved Red Robin that was my Favorite burger place and you ruined it for me big time. :'( I'm very disappointed in you Rancho Location Red Robin.

They remodeled and removed the big booths. We are a family of five and got stuck in a half booth with uncomfortable chairs. The service was great but the bar slow and the food was just OK. Two of the five burgers were under-cooked. The kids like the shakes but if we go to Red Robin again, it will be at a different store.

Burgers are solid. Fries are unlimited. Get over here and stuff your face! Seriously, the whole unlimited fries is a complete marketing ploy, but it works. I came here with 3 other guys, and we only got one two extra basket of fries, and only 2 of us ate them. On top of that, I didn't even really need to eat the extra fries! You know how you're at a party, and just constantly munching because it's there? That was me eating here. Fries COULD be better if they were fried to a crisp.

Came here wit my boyfriend and his parents the fries with the garlic is delicious. Server was pretty good. My pesto chicken burger wit provolone cheese was the bomb. The onli thing I didn't like was the drinks. It was like all the syrup sinked to the bottom and it had a strong disgustin after taste :(

I am updating our review. I was since contacted by management from Red Robin. They seemed extremely concerned reference are negative visit. They assured us that they would deal with the issues that we had during our visit.  My family and I returned on 9/20/14. Our server was Cynthia Z did a great job. Food was great and service was exceptional. Thank you red Robin for listening to your customers and taking their concerns seriously.

This review is applicable to any Red Robbin. I love a good burger, who does not like a good burger really? The vegetarians I suppose but I will not count them for this review. The Red Robin always does a good burger and the unlimited french fries are wonderful, though the basket that comes with your food is often cold, you just have to order a new basket and they come out piping hot, I usually do not even bother with the ones that come with the burger. Speaking of burgers, the Royal Robin is my favorite, love the fried egg on there. The whiskey river and the Bonzai burger are also good picks for a burger.  The wraps I have heard are good from other diners I have been with but to me this place will always be about a good burger and unlimited fries.

My family and I visited this location recently on a Friday evening for dinner.  There was a 20 minute wait for a table but that was acceptable considering it was Friday.  We enjoy Red Robin.  The decor, the food, the service is pretty much always top notch.  We definitely will continue to frequent this establishment.

My first time here.  Had the fish and chips (garlic fries).  If you are a french fry person you can have the bottomless steak fries.  My husband had the grilled chicken breast with salad.  If it wasn't for my nephews birthday and this being his choice.  I could probably do without coming back to this restaurant.  I wasn't impressed nothing special.  Food is resonably priced.  They have all sorts of bar food wings, burgers, salads.

Just what our area needed, yet another chain restaurant (saying this dripping with sarcasm).  This branch is located right across the street from the Victoria Gardens Mall, on the south side of Foothill Blvd (aka Route 66).  It's right near my new work, so I thought I'd give it a try since it's fairly new.  Large and spacious, the restaurant itself is warm and inviting.  Unfortunately, I can't say the same for a certain hostess/shill that was on duty today for lunch.  We came in and immediately sat ourselves in the bar area, since there were some open booths.  Then, the above mentioned hostess came up to our table, with about as much contempt as you can imagine, and then plopped our menus on the table, totally ignoring the greeting from my friendly co-worker.  The only way she could have been any ruder would have been to spray us both with pepper spray, and then kick us in the proverbial "jimmy".  Take note, restaurant managers:  A single employee can undo the goodwill of every other employee you have during a shift, as this person illustrates, because everyone else who helped us was great.  Why the 2 star rating?  Because I stomped out the other 2 stars with the army boots of my despise, and the other one is going to hell with the hostess who gave us a double barreled dose of attitude today.  I'll be back next week!  **Update 11/3/06**  Okay, went back there today, and the aforementioned hostess was actually there.  We went in, sporting for a showdown, but she was actually very nice today!!  So, in that spirit of redemption, I'm revising the review from 2 stars to 4 stars, in hopes we just caught her on an off day.

Like I've said in my other Red Robin review, my family and myself are regulars. We came here on Saturday and I have no complaints over the food. It's the horrible service! Before we ordered I asked the waiter to bring us fries since my kids were starving and fussy. I never got them. I decided to let it slide and carried on. We ordered the tower of onion rings and he brought them out but did not supply us with plates. Our waiter had to either leave or go on break, so he brought over "Allison". She was just all over the place. She brought our food but did not supply spoons for the kids mac and cheese. She spilled the ranch everywhere and never brought our refills. Finally she brings our check and my total is $46. & change. I Tip her 2 bucks for the horrible service and go on my way. On Tuesday morning I check my account and the payment posted as $54. And change. At that point I call them and speak to the manger and he told me that I tiped the waiter $8.00 on my credit card slip (which stupid me never writes 0) in other words she wrote $8 as a tip totaling $10 with the cash tip I left! Needless to say I was very upset and was yelling at the manager as he was not apologetic at all! I'm am sure I am not the only person they've done this to so heads up, always write 0 on the tip line! Lesson learned!

For some strange reason this tends to be where I end up after a day of shopping at the outlet.  It must be the freckled lemonade that seem to beckon me when I'm exhausted from shopping all day.  Nothing like a cold lemonade with sweet strawberry chunks to quench that thirst. Normally I get the burgers, particularly the A1 Peppercorn, but recently I've been wanting something different so I tried the Blacken Chicken.  YUM!!  What an understated sandwich!  The endless fries are always a bonus... so why not better rating?  *sigh* The service...  sometimes it's great other times it's terrible.
My service was HORRIBLE.  It took almost an hour to get our food every one else got their food around us and they arrived well after us. Never got drink refills. Won't be going back anytime soon.

While visiting with family we made a trip to their local Red Robin. Although the food was good the service was ridiculous. Our appetizers were brought out after half of our entrees.  2 of the appetizers never even came. The other half of the entrées finally came out after we were half way done eating. To top off the night the server messed up our bill which took an additional 15 minutes for her to resolve.  Although we enjoy the food I'll be hesitant to go back for a while.

Came here for lunch for a coworkers' birthday on Tuesday.  After some bad employment news from the mother-ship, I think anything would've cheered us up, especially the endless steak fries!!!  The service was awesome and they took care of the bill of our group very well and in timely fashion (which is sometimes a challenge for groups of workers looking to get back to the mother-ship on time.)  The shroom burger was packed with mesmorizing shroom flavors, but it's the fries and the Robin's seasoning that are the addictive treasures of this place.  The very distinct flavor of the Robin's seasoning always reminds me of munching on corn nuts during class back in highschool.  mmMmmMmmmmcooornnNNuuuUUTSssss! Random thought:  Ever wonder how much $$$ worth of pictures/frames are pasted on their walls?

I love this place! My kids love this place! Yes sometimes service sucks but have a talk to the manager and he takes complains seriously and helps. We have also had great service I wish we had the same server every time. The food is so delusions my new fav is the lettuce wedge w/0 blue cheese. But still so fresh and good. Onion tower is always a must and the burgers OMG! Yummmmm

Red Robin is awesome. I love their Banzai Burger!! I usually sit in the bar because you can get seated sooner. There is a server that usually works in the bar, I think his name is Ben. He is incredible!! He is friendly and he remembers our orders! Not like, he gets it right and brings us the correct food. I mean when we sit down, he says "NIce to see you again, do you guys want the usual?" The first time he said this, we looked at him stunned. We asked if he knew what that was and he listed off our order to us! We were very impressed (and slightly embarrassed that we go enough to have our order known like that! haha!). We love Red Robin anyway, but Ben makes the experience that much more enjoyable.
I like this place, I really do, but the last couple of times I've came to this place, the wait is HORRIBLE!! That is all.

Crazy how one visit can change your whole mindset about a restaurant. I was immediately seated fast and immediately greeted by our waiter. She also apologized ahead of time for being so out of breath because she was so busy. She made my friend and I feel very welcomed! On the receipt the server name is Holly and she was amazing! Such a hard and kind worker. I never had to ask for a refill. She checked on the food for us. The service was honestly the best I've had from any restaurant. Also, the burger was fantastic!!!!!! I got the whiskey bleu cheese burger. Keep in mind that I do not like bleu cheese very much, but I fell in love with this burger. Plus the bottomless garlic fries (99 cents more) were delicious. I could barely finish I second basket. When I did ask for the second basket I received it almost immediately. Overall, I do not have one complaint about this visit today (I complain a lot). The service and food were impeccable. Shoutout to the waitress Holly for making my lunch. Let's see how it is next time I visit.

Just left this fine establishment full and happy. The service was great, I wish I would've gotten the name of the waitress. She was both attentive and engaging. The food was delicious. Would recommend to anyone in the area!

location: West Jordan, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Very welcoming. We always eat in the bar area and the service is always excellent. The food is typical of a chain restaurant with nothing too exciting, but decent taste at a decent price.

So this was my second visit ever and rating based off both experiences. The first time I left thinking nothing extravagant would have been plenty happy at in n out. This visit I ordered a burger that in the details did not say avocado. Burger arrived with avocado. Most would be happy about this but I am allergic. So the server requested kitchen for another burger. Upon are visit it was busy yes but we asked 3 different people for a side of ranch multiple times and never received more after the first two small sides she had dropped off in the beginning are cups sat empty for too long in my opinion as well considering how often our server and other servers walked past our table. Our server was nice and friendly but just felt a bit annoyed that after forgetting so much and waiting so long for another burger that was there mistake not ours nothing was comped. I don't go around asking for free things but everyone was done eating when I finally got a new correct burger and felt that was wrong and poor customer service on their part.

I have always extremely disliked this place. I even started a review last year to express how much I hate the service here but I deleted it because no business likes bad yelp reviews, but after the incident that happened, I can't help but write one. I went here yesterday with my family because they love this place, but when we got there and got seated, first the manager took our drink orders which was no problem but when our drinks were delivered by the waitress first off, one of the drinks was wrong and secondly she (accidentally) dropped the entire glass into my lap. Surprisingly I was extremely calm about this considering she stained my white shirt and it was ridiculously sticky and all over me, but after she dropped the entire glass on me, she never came back and we had a different waiter the rest of the meal. Maybe she was embarrassed, but okay whatever.  I'm just upset that there was absolutely no compensation of any kind to make up for the waitress's slippery fingers. Nothing, at all. We all joked that maybe we should've complained a little bit more and we would've received something like a discount of some sort, anything to show their gratitude for their massive mistake into my lap. Maybe I was too nice about it, but I definitely would never come back here if I had the choice.

The Friday night shuffle was off the hook.. The menu was appetizing... various dishes to be desire, I chose the black and blue... Didn't disappoint, I even had trouble devouring it... The service was spectacular... Dakota was our waitress and took time out to get to know what we liked and was very patient and friendly... Maygen was also very nice...
Didn't take a drink order, appetizer came out after we finished our meal, hair in my soup. Went to the bar to wash it down and of course the lady was dumb and rude.

Devyn was awesome. We absolutely love all staff here but tonight she exceeded all expectations.  Honestly - a gem! Thanks for not only the amazing customer service but dealing with our crazy requests.

Food was great I did feel like they could have bigger portions of fries I know that it's bottomless but I felt like u was asking for refills every 5 minutes and I'm not even a fan of fries.  The server was awsome and there was a little bit of a wait. So if you plan on going on a sunday expect at least a 20 min wait.
25 min wait? Walked in to see why 13 tables not in use, Busboy on break or something. Management don't care, food is ok.

I have been to this and many other red Robins and have always had a 5 star experience. The food is awesome, huge servings and bottomless fries. We've always had good servers. I usually get their strawberry lemonade which comes with huge chunks of actual strawberries! And my go-to dish is usually the whisky river BBQ chicken wrap. Soooo good! My wife gets different salads and is always happy. We have 2 kids so we try to get a date night every so often. We always say we are going to try something new to be adventurous, but we just love it here so much that we almost always end up going. Definitely recommend.

Horrible service. Sitting here for over an hour & still no food. Very loud & definitely very slow service, even on a Wednesday night.  Talked with manager after receiving our food and did take care if our bill...big statement for him & the store. Still not sure I will be returning anytime soon.

Food was ok, other than cold fries. Are waitress was very slow, I had to wait ten minutes between refills and 15 mins to actually get drinks and order. Very disappointing, my kids live to go there for the dessert but we got tired of waiting and I actually had to go and find the waitress to give her my card so we can leave.
I normally like eating here, but to day I had the chili chili burger.  The meat was dry hard and way over cooked.  The French fries were too salty.
The hostess is as slow as a snail.   If you plan on eating here then plan on waiting along time to get seated.     Absolutely ridiculous.

I expected so much. It was less than average slow service .... Got bottom less fries and we only got them filled once because it took the waitress 30 mins to check back up. Shame shame shame it was our first and last. Thanks red robin.

Not bad.  Got 4 burgers, an appetizer, 4 sodas and a spiked ice tea, came to about $75 plus tip. That was a bit more than I was expecting.  I got a peppered bacon burger, that was tasty, though it had 2 lil pieces of peppered bacon and 2 regular bacons. What is up with that?  I am not good enough to get ALL peppered bacon?  It was a super juicy burger. Quite good actually.  Onion ring tower was tasty. Campfire sauce is good, the rest are pretty tame and flavorless, we tried a lot of them.  I don't like steak fries normally, but seasoning salt saves everything.  I got some spiked tea drink, it was tasty.  Service was good, we got the first table, so that blew. I couldn't hear anything. Everyone just sounded like noise. Whawhawhawhaw.  That's because my crappy hearing though. The place has been completely remodeled from the last time I went.   All in all, it was good, $60-65 good, $75 was a bit high.
3 words whiskey river burger! delicious. add in bottomless fries and im a full and happy customer. love this place. will be back
Love so many things here. The atmosphere,  the food, the servers. And so happy they brought their spinach artichoke dip back - it is the best,  bar none!
Gone here a few times and never disappointed. Great food, nice staff, and cold beer!! The burgers are great way better than any burger joint around. Five Stars!!

Food good.  Service bad. If there isn't any other place to eat, go to Red Robins.  We were there on Saturday 02/16/13.  We waited for our name to be called after 25 mins.  Only to hear over the PA system that it was a last call for my chance to claim my table, even though then never called me the first time.   Upon checking in, the hostess was too interested in texting and not doing her job.  She thought I was her to put in my name for a table.  Ugh.  So finally we were seated.  The waitress I think her name was Adrianne seated us and took our drink and appetizer order. We waited approximately 20 minutes and our appetizer arrived after our entree.  I tried to flag a waiter down since there weren't any forks or napkins on our desk, but there weren't any on the floor.  So we waited a few more minutes for that.   All in all the food is decent, not worth coming back for.  The service is lousy.

I need a job... Stopped by at 3:00pm after a day of snowboarding.  The hostess was very sweet and sat us immediately.  The server was very good! I could see her from afar checking in on us without bothering us. I was a server before and she did a good job.  I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with swiss cheese and the bottomless lemonade with strawberries. The drink was great but the burger was just blah. I ordered it medium rare.  I will never order it again here.  The drink however, was good! The fries were plain and even with a bit of spice, the fries at McDonald's are better to me. I must say, we stayed at this restaurant for about 45 minutes and 8 people walked in to apply for a job.  The server mentioned that the restaurant was already fully-staffed but people just keep on applying.  I guess Red Robin must be a great place to work.  The ambiance was all-Americana and I was impressed by their full-bar. Overall, the service was amazing, the environment was clean but the food was just average. I'd come again for the service and the lemonade. See you for dessert...

heres my personal experience with this company, I went on an interview (group interview) with this company about 8 years ago, at this location.....and I quote this is what they said to us "Do not allow your tables to sit with the same customers, feed them and move them out, we are into making money, not entertaining, esp those with kids" So.....I have not been there since! Take that for what you want, however there vegie burgers are pretty good!
Went to RR and had the Prime Rib Dip.  Excellent!  Highly recommend it.

I sure wish I could rate only the server, in that case I would l do 5. I enjoy leaving feedback, rating and letting it be known when I come across an excellent employee. For example "Erin" was our server that day and she was outstanding! What made her so good is that she was so busy, (she was the only server there), yes it was a Monday at 2:00 but still she  had several tables and she worked hard to accommodate everyone. She was funny, sincere, and helpful. The endless fries and peach shake was delicious.

Just took my son here for his birthday burger. This is where he wanted to eat because he had only tried it one other time years ago. Our server Nancy was a frowny faced waitress who had zero personality or serving skills. We had to wait long periods of time before even getting her to come to to our table. When she did show up we had to ask her for stuff, she never once saw our need or offered us anything. Then she would basically drop whatever we asked for off on her way to another table. My son saw another waitress pass by who had a pleasant smile and my son said I want her to be our waitress. I said I was just thinking the same thing. Sadly we were stuck with Cruella Deville. Some guy ended up bringing us our food, then Cruella returned with her frowny face to bring our bill without asking us if we would like dessert, at this point I didn't even want dessert anymore. The idea of giving my son a mini birthday song and dessert went right out the window with our crummy waitress. Thank Red Robin! I could have made it a memmorable moment for my son but now it just serves as an unhappy experience.

Their service is horrible! I don't know how my $6.99 burger and an iced tea ended up being $12.99 when the check came? That buger special was like a kids happy meal. If you can count how many fries are on your basket before you start eating there's a problem!

The customer service can be hit and miss but last night it was a hit! Her name was Britania, I hope I'm spelling it right and she was the best. Gave us ranch, more fries and refills before we can even ask.  But now that I got that out the way, onto the food. I love that they have a vegan burger on the menu. It sucks that you can only get it by switching it with another patty but it is still good. I would hope in the future they would just make it more simple and just put a vegan burger on the menu where u don't have to keep substituting things in and out of the burger. It makes it easier for the customer, waiter, and the chef and causes less mistakes. I have sometimes have asked for a bacon guacamole burger with a vegan patty instead, no bacon, no cheese, no mayo, and can you switch the bread? Its a mouth full to say and yea it's just a suggestion. I also love the bottomless drink and fries. It's a fairly good place to just grab a burger with some friends.
Been to red robin many times and I've experienced some poor service but I order the blue ribbon burger with jalapeño bun and it never fails me. Yuuummmm! :)

The chain has been reviewed before, but I thought i'd throw my 2 in and also add one to my Yelp account!  My daughter for some reason, loves this place. I don't know. I guess because it's noisy and loud and they give you free balloons. Kinda reminds me of the noise level at the old Farrell's Ice Cream parlor, but burger-style.  There were about 40 families w/ kids when we came- okay, maybe 20 or so, but still.  I guess that some people still think that if their kid acts up in a noisy place like this, they don't have to bother about quieting them down or taking them out.  Mind you, I HAVE a 6 year old, so i'm not adverse to kids in restaurants. But helllloooo... screaming SCREAMING kids next to me at a booth annoys the hell out of me.  I digress... sorry... Okay, that said... foodwise, good selection, although heavy on the fried side (and I love fried food).  The service is awesome. We commented each time we've come here, that the service has always been really good, and the managers make themselves visible.   The onion ring tower is really good, nice portion size w/ good sauces.  I got the fish and shrimp platter. Good slaw, nicely drenched in mayonaisse sauce- yum- but the fish and shrimp were just okay.  They could have been pulled out a couple min. earlier, as well as the fries, which are refillable (A plus!) One last thing- (Peeve?) The only thing I can complain other than something that can't be helped- is that for a kids refill on a drink, they should 'go green' and only bring one cup out vs. bringing out a bunch of new plastic cups. Such a waste.

Can't get enough of these burgers! Our waitress brought us three freckled lemonades without us asking her for refills! That was definitely a plus. Only downside was that as soon as our food came out, she brought us our check. I thought to myself "really? We just got our food" -___- other than that service was great.

The service is always great every time I come here. We always sit in the bar to avoid waiting a long time to be seated, especially on weekends. I came in a group and this place wasn't my first choice because I honestly believe they're overpriced. But whatever, we were hungry and still had a giftcard from Christmas we never used yet. So we decided to go today. I guess our meal was ok. I was tired of burgers so opted for the chicken wrap instead. My only complaint is that they're really cheap on their fries. I mean yeah, they're unlimited. But nights like today (Saturday) or weekends in general when they're super busy, I hate to keep asking our waiter for more fries and ranch. I mean he was struggling to get us napkins! Fries would just be too much for him to handle! Lol but I wish they would give us more like they used to. They became cheap over the years. But other than that, it's a good place to go. Just try and not sing the "Red Robin" jingle while you're there haha

OMG terrible.   My friend and I rolled into town a little late on Saturday night and were starving.  We're not familiar with this area, so headed to the shopping center to see what restaurants were around.  Every place we went to had a 45 minute to an hour wait or wanted to charge us to watch some fight they had on TV.  We were starving and were able to be immediately seated at Red Robin. We sat in the bar, which was nice to be away from the child guests in the main dining room.  A bartender immediately came up and took our drink order, was prompt to return with our drinks and take our order.   We ordered some cheese sticks and jalapeno coins for a starter and you can't go wrong deep frying frozen items.  We then got our burgers.  We should have went to In n Out .  I got through about 1/3 of mine because it just didn't taste right.  My friend, who bragged that she could house tons of Red Robin maybe ate half. Then we were ignored.  The original bartender disappeared and the other one went to everyone around us but us.  When I tried to get the bartender's attention because I wanted another cocktail, he returned with our check and the dessert menu and about ran off when I was able to stop him and tell him I wanted a drink.  While he prepared the drink, my friend and I decided we wanted dessert to get the nasty burger taste out of our mouths.  He dropped my drink off and ran off again without giving us a chance to order.  And then for the next 5 minutes, checked on everyone but us.  I saw the manager at the bar, so I went up to the bar and asked if I should order here.  The manager really didn't seem to care. The dessert was good.  Apple pie something or another that needed more than one scoop of ice cream for how big it was.   Thank heaven we decided to go back to our hotel after this rather than continue our night out because I immediately started having stomach cramps when we got back thinking I was going to vomit.  Luckily I went to sleep and it passed until the morning.  My friend wasn't as fortunate as I and spent the majority of the 1st half of our Sunday in the bathroom.   I feel violated that I spent what was way too much money for bad meat and bad service.  I regret this decision and will never visit any other Red Robin ever.

We stopped in for a beer after work. Sat at the bar and got a couple of cold beers. The beer selection is nothing special (bud, coors...etc blue moon.) The beer was cold and was served with a smile. We did order some fries and the bartender brought us a couple different dipping sauces so that was cool. We did not order any other food so I cant comment on what the service was like. But the bar staff was quick and nice.

Decided to go to red robin last night for dinner...always good food. Me and the hubby ordered an appetizer and a burger each. The place was really busy which was surprising for a Thursday night after 8:30pm.  All in all even though it took longer than usual and we really didn't see to much of our waiter and had to wait on refills on our drinks the food was still delish.

Red Robin is one of my favorite places to get a non-fast food chain burger. My favorite is their Royal Red Robin. Something about a fried egg on top of your burger is just sooo YUMMY! To top it off, I love the pomegranate and blueberry limeade (it's not on the menu anymore, but just ask the server, they can still make it for you) which I always ask for a to-go cup at the end, and the bottomless steak fries extra crispy. YUM!

At first I was going to give my review 1 star for service because of what happened to us while dinning in...  First they seated a group before us when we were there first.  Which Annie apologized for.  Then our food took over an hour.  We ordered around 8 p.m, our food did not arrive until 9:03 pm.  Then it arrived in parts. 4 people, then another 5 minutes; 2 people, then another 10 minutes; 1 person.  so we did not get to eat together.  However, the manager Ms. Crystal was very pleasant and stepped up when a situation arose.  She was very apologetic and made sure our experience while waiting was compensated. I was extremely impressed with her professionalism, patience, friendliness, and helpful personality.  Usually the behavior of an employee is what makes or breaks a customer's loyalty to a company.  Our initial experience would have made us never return to this particular Red Robin.  However because of Crystal, we will be returning if a opportunity presents itself.

After driving 'round and 'round looking for a place to eat, we finally ended up here.  Since we didn't know what we wanted to eat, we thought we'd go cheap at Panda Express.  Then we saw Buffalo Wild Wings and thought we'd give it a go, but since they couldn't seat us for 30 minutes we booked out of there (really?  30 minutes for that?!).  Our next stop was Joe's Crab Shack, but I just didn't feel like putting a lot of effort for eating.  Long story short, we ended up here. Hostess seemed out of it and took a little bit to actually seat us.  We ordered the RR buzzard wings early on, but they didn't get to us until after our burgers came.  Not worth it at all.  The wings were all drumettes that were cooked to death.  Yuck. I ordered the 5 Alarm Burger (with some pink) and thought it was pretty tasty.  It's a smaller burger than what you'd find at Islands or Fuddruckers, but the meat itself is tender and juicy.  Oh, and it's not nearly as hot as the "5 alarm" may suggest.  In fact, it's pretty tame. So why the 3 stars?  Well, it's a good burger, but it's still just a burger (plus I have a built-in bias against "gourmet" burgers, really unless it was made with kobe or wagu beef, or has sauteed truffles, can you really consider any burger "gourmet?").  Better to save some dough and stop at Farmer Boys or Carl's instead.

Good burgers, good drinks, good service. Red Robin is a chain restaurant with the typical Friday's-inspired decor and overall feel. I've been to this particular location probably 50 times and I've had good service every time. I can't see anyone complaining about the food as it simply is what it is, a cookie cutter national chain burger place. I mean, for the money, the burgers are good and I don't know? Maybe great.

This was my first time eating at Red Robin. I've always wanted to try it because of their commercials on TV. I wanted to know exactly have good their so called gourmet burgers are. Honestly, I was kind of disappointed. I guess my expectations were too high. Their burgers are good, but nothing to write home about. Their smoothies are great though. I ordered the Strawberry Banana one, I liked it better than my burger. The wait for our food was pretty long. I was finished with my smoothie before out burgers showed up. I don't drink frozen things very fast if that's what your thinking. A plus is that they give you unlimited fries with your order of any burger. They are kind of stingy about the quantity of fries they give you each time though. There aren't that many in the basket so you have to ask for more whenever you run out. I guess they don't want to waste any. All and all my experience at Red Robin was meh at best. I think the food is mediocre.
Ok service, didnt really check up on us so much but they were friendly

I don't understand why people like this place so much. The burger was overcooked and the shredded lettuce had way too much mayonnaise. I understand the appeal of unlimited french fries, but if I want a burger at a comparable price, I would go to Fuddruckers. I think they do a great job at making commercials that convey appealing hamburgers, but the product does not add up.

This is my favorite place for a cheeseburger. The management must be good because the service we receive here has always been excellent. I don't usually expect much from a chain restaurant but the food has always been good and the servers don't forget about you, even when its really busy.

I'm sure you're thinking "Why in the hell is someone even putting a review up, for a  CHAIN restaurant like Red Robin" Well I'm mainly putting this review up on this exact Location for this Red Robin.  The food is consistently good and that is always a huge thing in my book, I love there Burgers, the meat and seasoning seems to just go so well together and the fact that they have "Endless fries" HOW GREAT IS THAT! I work down the street from this place and so we eat her often and every time the food is  ON TIME,GREAT TASTING and the one girl at the Bar is SUPER NICE and goes out of her way for the customers.....we make sure to give her a great time ever time!
Yummy! Best burgers around. Love the endless fries! servers are always friendly and service is fast! Good place

Red robins is cheap and has decent food. However, they have exceptional beverages and fries! I love love love their unlimited fries (regular, and garlic). The burgers are mediocre, as well as their service.
The burgers here are very filling.  I like the fries, and the fries here are unlimited if you get a burger.

I have come here countless times with my family, and my opinion of this place has never really changed: nothing to rave about. I do t know how many times I have been here and something has gone wrong. Some people might say "then don't go there anymore." But it's a place my family enjoys regardless of my opinions.  Our most recent visit, we arrived about 10 minutes after they opened, and we were asked to wait for 10 more minutes, while they set up and "assigned stations". In my opinion, if you say you open at 11, you are open, and ready to seat customers as soon as the clock hits 11. Then, we were seated, and out server came right away. Redemption. Not quite. As one member of our party ordered Diet Coke and two others ordered Coke, he brought the drinks, and set them down. As soon as the person who ordered diet took a sip, she wasn't sure if it was diet or regular. So after tasting, we decided he had switched a diet with a regular, and left us guessing which was which. Then our order came out and he placed it on the table. Red Robin is famous for their gourmet burgers. They also have a large presentation on their menu on options of "trade this for that" "make it your own" so I take advantage of it. I usually order a burger that comes on an onion bun, and has Dijon sauce on it, but I always ask them to switch the bun for a sesame seed bun and to not put the sauce on. When the order arrived, the server put down the plate and said "here is your burger on a sesame seed bun!" When it clearly was not on a sesame seed bun. They did not put the sauce, like I asked, but the didn't put the other sauce that comes on it either. Their staff could be a little more aware of orders, and how they're prepared. If I were a server, I would be embarrassed to serve someone the incorrect thing, and to say it is what they ordered, when it was clearly not.

I was there this past sunday for the car cruise they have there. The restaurant was not that busy but the food took forever. To get more fries was slow to get refills on drinks and order a few more beers took forever. The serive was horrible as it always is. The worst part was the manager ed  tries to sing elvis what a joke. Dogs were running when this guy opens his mouth. Overall since the manager ed cancelled the car cruise no reason to go here anymore. The reason they had a poor car count was always due to the bad and slow service and eds horrible singing that is a fact!! The dj that runs the deal did all he could but the manager of the joint did nothing to make people feel welcome. and by him lying to all that were there that we will be back next year well i know 23 cars that wont buddy!

I wouldn't normally write a review for a widely reviewed chain, but this place is pretty lousy. I got a chocolate shake with weird "chunks" in it. My server explained that some of it was strawberry that hadn't been cleaned off the mixer, but she didn't know what the other things were. There was no offer for a new one (not that I wanted another after that), but I had to ask it be taken off of my bill when my check finally came. Another time I had ordered a burger with a veggie patty, as per usual, and it came out with a meat patty. So, I don't go there anymore.

My wife and I decided to go here last month to satisfy my great desire for GOOD fish & chips. She had the prime rib dip with garlic parmesan fries. They didn't disappoint. Best fish & chips I've had in years and the garlic parmesan fries were very tasty. It made me wonder why we'd stopped going. Went back again this month for my birthday and got their burnin love burger. WOW!!! awesome! For me, this was the best burger I'd had at Red Robin. The food was great. The service was excellent both times we went. We'll definitely be back. I read the earlier review about someone else delivering food and pondered it for a bit. This isn't a 5-star restaurant and I don't expect the same type of service from it. I'd rather my food be delivered when it's ready and hot than wait for my server to be done with his/her other tables first. The staff was friendly. The order was taken promptly. Food came back quickly. The servers came back and checked on how we were doing. We were offered refills on soda and fries before they were empty. Our sodas were never empty the whole time we were there. The check was delivered and processed promptly. (One of my pet peeves is after eating our dinner, we often have to sit and wait for 15 to 20 minutes to get the check and pay for it. Not so here.) All in all, both visits were awesome. I still prefer Islands for burgers, but there's so much more variety at Red Robin.

Red Robin..I have kids..The kids are happy at Red Robin, My niece and Nephew are happy at red robin..Sevice is always good-Great, people like working here, I always get the blue cheese burger, last time, I got a bacon cheese burger by mistake..didn't send it back as I thought what the heck...I'll try it..it was lame...but the blue burger and several others I've ordered kicked butt! Good place for families, kids....I can't wait for another Blue burger!

This place has pretty good food at reasonable prices. I got the bacon cheeseburger which was actually a little plain. The prices are decent $10 for the burger and fries. The endless fries are probably the best part along with the red robin seasoning, but if your really looking for a good burger go down to Ontario Mills and eat at fuddruckers. The only issue there is they don't have a bar!
