if you dot he math... they have pretty decent burger... let say they are at the same level with those 6 dollar burger of Carl's jr. or better... and at around 10 bucks you get a nice burger and an endless fries...and if you get large fries outside its around 3 bucks... with an extra buck you'll get unlimited fries...and usually they have nice service...and you can never go wrong with their menu... it's just up to you on what do you want in your burger... but sometimes.. just like the fastfood places... they tend to overcook the burger...  i brought my nephew here... and he thought the cheese burger was just ok... he still loves in and out... so i don't know....

Wow.  I was always fairly happy with this place until I went last week with some friends.  Again, wow.  I am shocked at how criminally bad it was to have dinner there. The ups: 1. Our waiter, Kent, did everything he could to try and save our experience.  Great waiter, who unfortunately, works at a restaurant with bad practices. 2. The food (I had the BBQ pork sandwich) was pretty good, but see notes below. The downs: 1. This list will be longer than I feel comfortable with: 2. Someone other than our waiter delivered our food, and yes, there was a problem.  My friend who is allergic to dairy, who specifically asked for her chili burger without cheese, got a nice, heaping stack of cheese on her chili burger. The waiter knew this.  But the person who delivered our food didn't.  Dumb.  Just dumb.  This is definitely becoming my pet peeve at restaurants now.  Moreso, because they have to ask who gets what..because lord knows they didn't take your order, and lord knows they wouldn't know their butts from a hole in the ground if it was messed up. 3. They have waiters working too many tables.  Our poor waiter was working his ass off, and still not making it back to our table frequently enough.  It wasn't like he was standing around doing nothing, so I blame the restaurant's waiter to table ratio. 4. Pet peeve numero due: restaurants that have people sweeping the floor right next to you as you eat.  Yummy: dust and crap in the air, my food, and now in my mouth.  Extra points Red Robin for seating me right (and I mean 1 ft) from the trash can, separated by a non-sealed glass divider, where said sweeping was dumped. 5. French fries came hot, but soggy. 6. After we had finished eating, a MANAGER, (or at least a manager appearing person), stopped at our table, said nothing, and right in the middle of my friends sentence, reached directly in front of her face, and cleared a plate...IN FRONT OF HER FACE, still saying nothing, and walking away.  No excuse me, no could I clear that, nothing.  Just reaching and interrupting by odd and awkward physical action. 7. On our way out, despite being obviously busier than hell, there were no less than five employees standing in the bar, gawking at TV. 8. As a minor annoyance, the restaurant layout is completely open, without fabric deadeners, so basically if there are more than 10 tables seated, the restaurant runs at a pretty good din, and you have to speak quite loudly to be heard, and lean in (refer back to plate cleared in front of face) to hear what anyone at your own table is saying. All of that said, again, wow.  This has to be the one of the worst dining experiences I've had in recent memory.   I don't naturally gravitate toward Red Robin, but it's safe to say now I will not be returning.  Ever.  Never ever.

I have been to Red Robin restaurants in other states. Their service is far superior to this location's. The burgers are OK - nothing fabulous and the fries are over-seasoned. What is making me not return to this location is being consistently ignored by the hosts/hostesses while seating people - they actually walked around me to seat a family that came in AFTER I did, even though I was standing there waving my arms to get someone's attention, and the waitress kept forgetting about our table. I gave them a 2nd shot on a different date and still experienced the same indifferent service. This is what's going to prevent me from returning - the staff that apparently feels like they have enough customers already so they could really care less if you returned or not.

I've been to several Red Robins in the past but its been a long time since I eat at this one.  The reason why I gave it such a low rating is because of the horrible service.  Even when we first arrived the host was not friendly at all she was kinda rude.  Once we ordered our food the waitor messed up 3 of our orders and when he brought them back he still didn't get the order the right.  I understand people make mistakes but what bothered me most was they seemed very unappoligetic they didn't even offer us a discount or free desert I guess since we didn't make a scene they didn't offer us one.  To me that is unacceptable customer service, I enjoy Red Robins food but I definatly would avoid this location because it obviously does not care at all about customer service.  I don't know if it happens a lot here but this was my experience eating here.  On a postivie the milkshakes and whisky river burger are awesome =)
Been back twice & We have had great service. Glad to be back LOL

Family birthday dinner that was for 12. They put us in a small area that was kind of congested. Our waiters name was Claudia , I felt her service could have been better. She really wasn't on top of refills or checking on how we were doing. Most restaurants take the cake and store it until we are ready, but today was not the case. Tables were all sticky and they never came to wipe them when we told them about it

Another great place another fun place for the kids.  They love the fries and love the strawberry lemonade Service is great and food quality is better than average. This location we go to many times a year and never have been treated unfairly.  Love it.

Long story short: waited an hour before leaving without being served. I've never been to a Red Robin before but have always wanted to try it out, it looks good! But after getting the run around for an hour we decided to leave. Here's what happened, we sat down and ordered our food, the peppercorn burger and Western charm, and had been talking for about half an hour before wondering where our food was. After a bit, our server came back and told us how sorry he was about the wait but it would be out soon. Another 15 minutes pass and he sends out another server to give us fries. Another 5 pass and he comes back to reassure us that it'll just be a few more minutes. At this point it was 5:50 and we got there an hour before, they must've had to slaughter the cow in the back or something... Our server came back and the same story, it'll be ready soon. At this point we were tired of sitting there for an hour and got up and left. I talked to the hostess and let her know we were leaving and to cancel the orders. I ended up going to McDonald's across the street and wish i did that from the start.  Your server screwed up and i wish he was honest. Instead of giving us the run around, he should've let us know that he forgot the order (or what ever the excuse) and it would take another 20 minutes. If that was the case, we would've gotten an appetizer! It's that simple! It really wouldn't have been a big deal, but waiting and being led on for an hour is what pissed me off. I've never walked out of a restaurant before, but I'm surprised we stayed as long as we did.

Gourmet Burgers and UNLIMITED FRIES at reasonable prices.  The Good: Normally has great service. The food is tasty, original and filling. They have some very good menu items: The Royal Red Robin Burger is awesome!! The Southwest Chicken Pasta was eliminated and then recently brought back which is amazing! The Clucks and fries are delicious, especially cajun style. Who can argue with unlimited, refillable french fries?!? They also have very good seasonings and amazingly good ranch dressing. The freckled lemonade is great!   The Bad: Very fatty, i feel like i never leave here without eating at least 3000 calories. Can get really busy on a weekend night, like it's a good date place or something, it's not.

Red Robin has always been my favorite go to place, yet not today. Service was slow. They said it was because they were busy,yet there were quite a few empty tables. The waitress forgot one of my requests. It will be awhile before I return to this Establishment

First time customer and I will never return. Worst customer service, wait is extremely long while they have empty tables, waitress was extremely rude and unprofessional, and took it took about 30 minutes to receive our order. Please people, save your money and go elsewhere where they will actually appreciate your patronage.

So decided to try this place again, despite the bad service. Wrong choice. Thirty five minute wait on a Tuesday?? Go walk around, twenty five open tables!! I asked the hostess, she said two seconds were closed....okay..what's that eight tables...she said week I think someone no showed in the kitchen...I explain...I've worked in restaurants forever, my general manager would be so upset if these tables weren't Sat. She said the general manager was in the kitchen. I couldn't believe it. Not even worth getting him. We left and went to Slater 50/50. Worth the extra money. Oh and the bathrooms were disgusting ...again.
Giving 4 stars always  good food but needs to have more things on there lite menu! Would love to see a ahi burger!

Our first time here the kids wanted to try this place. We were seated immediately since the place wasn't that busy today. When we walked in the girl standing at the front booth (with the Stars tattooed on the right side of her neck) was not friendly, no smile or hello she just walked us back to our table and that was that. The food here was nothing special my son ordered their Tavern burger with fries; I ordered the fish and chips with sweet potatoes and my daughter ordered the kids meals with pasta and broccoli. Our server was ok nothing amazing she never came back to offer refill on their endless fries or have our drinks refilled. Would of rather go to In N Out burgers service would have been better and wouldn't cost that much for ordinary burgers, lacking customer service and not worth the price. They have a tablet on the table that the kids can play unlimited games but you will be charged $1.99 for the games. Also after our meals you can just pay for it at the table on the tablet have receipt emailed or printed at your table. Don't know why I needed to tip if customer service was very lacking at this establishment. Would I return?  Hell no would rather go to In N Out and my kids all agreed!!! Oh well first time for everything but would not return.

The service was terrible I will give it to the waitress they did over seater. it took 20 minutes for them to come back and check on us half of us got our food the other half waited 10 minutes no fry refills I told the manager and she did not take care of us. won't be going back to this one.

We came here for dinner at about 8pm on Aug 8 and had Jason as our server. Jason was WONDERFUL.  He was friendly and attentive.  We ordered the $3 wedge salads, the chili queso, a Bonzai burger and a Patty Melt.  Everything was delicious!  Its not 2 days later and my husband is still raving about his burger.  My ONLY complaint is that the booth table is not adjustable and bring large chested, it is nice to be able to push a table a little away from me.  I couldn't hear.  But, that will not keep us away!  We will be back and SOON!

Positive: Burgers is one of the best we have had & the gravy that comes with the black & bleu burger is super good. Our waiter Bruce was very attentive & looked like he was so happy & proud to have been serving us. The lady who seated us even changed the channel of the tv so we could watch the Warriors game.  Negative: we had to wait for half an hour to get seated when we could see that there are a lot of empty tables inside. Maybe it's their way of controlling the orders but anyhow, the staff & food are worth coming back for.

Waiting time wasn't too bad for a Friday night. But service was HORRIBLE. We ordered salsa and chips to munch on while we wait for our food..... Well by the time we got our "5 chips with salsa" our food came right after. We would have reminded our waitress to check on the chips but she was no where to be found. Our waitress didn't bring our food. Some other lady did. Our waitress took forever to check on us to see if we needed anything with our meals. Which my boyfriend needed mustard so he had to wait awhile to dig into his burger. Not once did our waitress stop by to ask us if we needed refills or how our food was. We had the bottomless fries and wanted a refill, of course waitress no where to be found. We see the manager pass by and had to ask her to bring more fries. Finally done with our meal we were going to order dessert. We were still looking and looking for our waitress, finally we see her up front talking away holding a baby! So we gave up on the dessert and our waitress finally came over and asked my dad are you paying cash or card. My dad says card and she says "oh go ahead and pay there" she points at the ziosk on the table and walks away. We were in disbelief how rude she was. Fed up we called the manager Caitlyn over. We explained to her how poor the service was and she genuinely apologized and charged us no fee for our dinner. She made sure that we do come back and ask for her personally so she is sure that we have an excellent experience... And as for dessert, we went to Baskin Robins.

I looooove this place! Especially when you are part of their Royalty rewards program, you get points, that lead to free stuff and discounts through emails and a free burger in your birthday. Been coming here for years, and we've always had great service!

Haven't been here in weeks and apparently they've remodeled. Waiting area has wooden gates around and took away the claw machines. Menu is cleaner and in a booklet rather than the big double sided menu. Had the guacamole bacon burger, petite size because I can never finish the huge burger, peach iced tea (not too sweet) and a vanilla shake (pretty good, less whip cream though). Their unlimited basket of fries paired with a burger is always a plus. I love their honey mustard at this restaurant, sweet!
Good food, good service .  We will definately return. Highly  recommend  the onion rings.  Great app for 4-5.  I had the chicken tender salad with honey mustard dressing.  Delicious all around.

Four words. Bottomless root beer floats. Yum! My complaint would be that they're switching to automated ordering, which I dislike. Also, the wait staff is constantly forgetting things I ask for (like more water). I try to ask when I order so they don't forget, but they still do. Every time.

We had dinner at the bar this evening during a super busy night. Nancy was our bartender & she did an awesome job. Her customer service was excellent during the dinner rush hour!! We will definitely be back!!

Came here with a party of 10 waited 30 minutes for 2 drinks they forgot for the kids and no tartar sauce for the fish and chips. service not the best tables that people had been done eating and not cleaned also the kitchen floor a mess . not the right way for a manager to run a restaurant won't be coming back sorry
